Title: Applied Data Scientist
Description:
Microsoft’s Health and Life Sciences team is dedicated to empowering healthcare organizations ton achieve their goals and improve patient care. We aim to create an efficient and connected healthcare ecosystem by bringing the healthcare ecosystem together which empowers everyone across the healthcare journey to collaborate, communicate, and innovate together to provide better experiences for their workforces and patients or members alike.

Our team has an exciting opportunity for an Applied Data Scientist to expand our Dragon Ambient eXperience (DAX) product to international markets. DAX listens to doctor/patient conversations and

writes highly accurate clinical summaries of the encounter for review by the physician. DAX is an industry leading solution in the US healthcare market, and we are expanding our languages and market to include Germany and France.

#hlsp #dax-intl

Responsibilities

Responsibilities include:


Demonstrate broad understanding of state-of-the-art in machine learning concepts and applications.
Collaborate directly with product leaders, researchers, and engineers within Microsoft Health and Life Sciences division.
Develop state-of-the-art clinical summarization technology using advanced LLM capabilities in multiple languages.
Identifies approaches, and applies, improves, or creates a research-backed solution (e.g., novel, data driven, scalable, extendable) to positively impact DAX international summarization.
Applies language expertise and knowledge of clinical documentation to create high-quality clinical summaries for European markets.
Performs data analysis by reviewing criteria that reflect quality and technical constraints. Reviews data for inclusion in model training, taking actions to address data quality problems.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications


Doctorate in relevant field OR equivalent experience
Demonstrated research or applied science experience in Natural Language Processing
Proven experience with LLM technologies and generative AI
Language fluency in English AND French or German, or Dutch


Other Requirements

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check:


This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


Preferred/Additional Qualifications


Experience in medical text analytics and/or clinical information retrieval
Experience with text summarization and/or text generation


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Our team has an exciting opportunity for an Applied Data Scientist to expand our Dragon Ambient eXperience (DAX) product to international markets. DAX listens to doctor/patient conversations and

writes highly accurate clinical summaries of the encounter for review by the physician. DAX is an industry leading solution in the US healthcare market, and we are expanding our languages and market to include Germany and France.

#hlsp #dax-intl

Responsibilities

Responsibilities include:


Demonstrate broad understanding of state-of-the-art in machine learning concepts and applications.
Collaborate directly with product leaders, researchers, and engineers within Microsoft Health and Life Sciences division.
Develop state-of-the-art clinical summarization technology using advanced LLM capabilities in multiple languages.
Identifies approaches, and applies, improves, or creates a research-backed solution (e.g., novel, data driven, scalable, extendable) to positively impact DAX international summarization.
Applies language expertise and knowledge of clinical documentation to create high-quality clinical summaries for European markets.
Performs data analysis by reviewing criteria that reflect quality and technical constraints. Reviews data for inclusion in model training, taking actions to address data quality problems.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications


Doctorate in relevant field OR equivalent experience
Demonstrated research or applied science experience in Natural Language Processing
Proven experience with LLM technologies and generative AI
Language fluency in English AND French or German, or Dutch


Other Requirements

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check:


This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


Preferred/Additional Qualifications


Experience in medical text analytics and/or clinical information retrieval
Experience with text summarization and/or text generation


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Data Science Internship
Description:
What is Euroconsumers?

As a leader in the consumer organization, Euroconsumers has been dedicated to promoting consumers’ rights for over 60 years. They provide various services to their members, including researching, testing, and evaluating products and services to help consumers make informed decisions. Their goal is to empower consumers to protect themselves from unfair practices and promote transparency in the marketplace.




Euroconsumers also advocates for consumer rights at a national and European level through lobbying and policy work. With their headquarters in Brussels, they represent over 1 million consumers in 4 countries across Europe. Their network of independent organizations has made them a leading voice for consumers in Europe. In conclusion, Euroconsumers is an organization committed to protecting consumers’ rights and promoting transparency in the marketplace.




What will you be working on?

Euroconsumers collects and analyses data about food products to inform consumers about the quality of these products. Next to testing these food products in laboratories Euroconsumers also collects information from the labels on these food products by taking pictures of the packaging. These pictures are subsequently read by OCR tools and extracted to internal databases. This process currently contains inefficiencies (such as requiring manual interventions to verify and correct the scanned data).




Your mission as an intern is to assess alternative approaches to extract information from the pictures using machine learning techniques and assess the impact of these techniques on the performance of the collection process (i.e. quality of the extraction and amount of post processing required).




What do we offer to you?

Hands-on experience in a dynamic and challenging environment.
Exposure to an internal R&D project with a focus on a practical application.
Mentorship and guidance from experienced professionals.
Warm and open company culture.
Hybrid working environment with 2-3 days per week at our office in Brussels (near Midi Station).




What do we expect from you?

Positive attitude with an excellent work ethic and strong attention to detail.
Good command of English, both written and spoken.
Strong programming background in Python.
Experience with the Data Science ecosystem of libraries in Python (Pandas, Scikit-learn, PyTorch, Keras)
Experience in computer vision, specifically in Optical Character Recognition (OCR), using either traditional or Deep Learning based approaches.




How to apply?

To apply for the Internship position, please send your resume and cover letter to job@test-aankoop.be or apply via LinkedIn.

Be sure to mention “Euroconsumers – Data Science Internship” in the subject line of your email.




We look forward to meeting you!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer F/M/X
Description:
We are currently seeking a Machine Learning Engineer to join our dynamic team at Amaris Consulting, located in Belgium. This role is a unique opportunity for those passionate about AI and machine learning, looking to apply their skills in a challenging yet rewarding environment.

🔥Your Responsibilities:

Developing machine learning models from scratch and improving existing ones
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and provide appropriate solutions.
Data preprocessing including data cleaning, normalization, and transformation.
Evaluating model performance using suitable metrics and validation techniques
Maintaining clear documentation of the development process for future reference and audits
Staying updated with the latest trends in machine learning algorithms, tools, industry best practices
Promoting knowledge sharing within the team through presentations or workshops on new findings or technologies related to ML/AI
Troubleshooting any issues that arise during the development or deployment of ML models

🎯 Your Profile:

The ideal candidate is a recent graduate who has a strong passion for artificial intelligence (AI) & machine learning (ML). You should be eager to learn new things continuously while being able to work effectively as part of a diverse team.

A bachelor’s degree in computer science/engineering/mathematics or related field is required; a masters degree is advantageous.
Familiarity with Python programming language along with libraries such as TensorFlow/Keras/PyTorch used in ML applications.
An understanding of various Machine Learning algorithms like Regression Models, Decision Trees etc., along with their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
Good understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture
An analytical mindset with problem-solving skills.
Ability to troubleshoot complex software issues
Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders
Able to work independently as well as in a team environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and French or Dutch.
Minimum 1 to 7 years of experience.




🚀 Advantages:

An international learning environment
Extensive training and certifications.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.

💡 We are an independent company that values:

Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.




Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




WHAT IS A DATA SCIENTIST AT CREAM?

As Robin, Data Scientist, you will have a key role in the implementation of innovative data models to solve specific business issues. You will be part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team. You will discover various industries.




YOUR TASKS:

You gather business requirements to better understand your client’s needs
You dive in a large amount of data to discover is hidden
You provide data-driven recommendations to the client
Based on your client’s needs, you apply predictive analysis and machine learning
You bring out concrete and predictive models
At the end, you help the business to better optimize the use of their data
data




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have at least 2 years of experience in Data Science
You want to learn more about Machine Learning, Robotics Process Automation (RPA)…
You are used to work with one of the following technologies : MATLAB, R, SAS, Python, Java …
You have good communication and synthesis skills
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day

We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
We currently have a vacancy for a Data Scientist fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert who will be based in Brussels, Belgium. The work will be carried out either in the company's premises or on site at customer premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client's IT team on site.

Your tasks

  • Collect business requirement and develop advanced data mining solutions;
  • Identify, assess and deploy relevant existing data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solution;
  • Specification and design of presentation interfaces with optimal usability/user experience;
  • Identify, collect, convert and update different data types/sets in several locations (e.g. ETL);
  • Produce data models according to specific problems statements;
  • Scripting and programming;
  • Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack (including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions etc...);
  • Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as necessary to address cross-project interdependencies


Requirements

  • University degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 17 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Experience in Azure;
  • Experience in using the suite of PowerApps;
  • Experience with languages like R, Python, PERL;
  • Experience in data visualization using power BI;
  • Excellent knowledge of Power app developer, low code and no code development;
  • Excellent knowledge of Data Analytics techniques and tools;
  • Excellent knowledge of continuous code delivery and unit testing;
  • Excellent knowledge of SharePoint Online;
  • Good knowledge of business intelligence tools (Tableau, SAS, SAP, GoodData...);
  • Good knowledge of ETL processes and tools (i.e. Talend Open Studio...);
  • Good knowledge of SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL);
  • Knowledge of architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores;
  • Knowledge in one of the following areas: predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive (simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, social media crawling and processing, plagiarism detection, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation systems;
  • Certifications in Microsoft Azure would be considered an asset;
  • Excellent command of the English language.


Benefits

If you are seeking a career in an exciting and dynamic company, where you will offer your services as part of a team of a major European Institution, operating in an international, multilingual and multicultural environment where you can expect real chances to make a difference, please send us your detailed CV in English, quoting reference: (91559/08/24).

We offer a competitive remuneration (either on contract basis or remuneration with full benefits package), based on qualifications and experience. All applications will be treated as confidential.

You may also consider all our other open vacancies by visiting the career section of our web site (www.eurodyn.com) and follow us on Twitter (@EURODYN_Careers) and LinkedIn.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (www.eurodyn.com)is a leading Software, Information and Communication Technologies company, operating internationally (Athens, Brussels, Luxembourg, Copenhagen, Stockholm, London, Nicosia, Hong-Kong, Valetta, etc). The company employs over 1000 engineers, IT experts and consultants (around 3% PhD, 36% MSc and 53% BSc or equivalent). We design and develop software applications using state-of-the-art technology. The group generates annual revenues in the range of EURO 40 million, with an EBITDA in the range of 20%. The value of our contract portfolio exceeds EURO 250 million. EUROPEAN DYNAMICS is a renowned supplier of IT services to government institutions, multinational corporations, public administrations and multinational companies, research and academic institutes.

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, we are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) adheres to the General Data Protection Regulation principles by applying its Privacy Policy as published in www.eurodyn.com/privacy. By submitting an application to this position and by sharing your personal data with ED, you acknowledge and accept its Policy and authorise ED to process your personal data for the purposes of the company's recruitment opportunities, in line to the Policy.

Furthermore, when providing your data, it is up to you to explicitly consent that your data can be assessed for future job openings, for as long as you do not withdraw such consent. If you do not consent, we will not be able to consider the data you provide to us for future job openings.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - LLM
Description:
LLM - Python for Machine Learning

Experience: 2 - 15 Years

Location- Permanent Remote Anywhere in the world

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, 5 hours Mandatory overlap with PST

Total Years Of exp- 2+ years Mandatory

Mandatory Skills- Python: min 2 years, Python for Data Science: min 1 yr, Machine Learning: min 1 yr, PyTorch: min 1 yr, Keras: min 1 yr, Tensorflow: min 1 yr

Key skills: Python, ML, PyTorch, Keras, TensorFlow

Job Responsibilities


Develop, train, and deploy machine learning models using TensorFlow and/or PyTorch.
Implement machine learning models and preprocessing pipelines using Scikit-learn.
Apply supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, including SVM, Decision Trees, Random Forest, and k-NN, to solve complex problems.
Design and implement deep learning architectures such as CNNs, RNNs, GANs, and transfer learning models.
Explore and apply reinforcement learning techniques to enhance AI solutions.


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
At least 2+ years of experience as a Python-focused Engineer.
1+ years of experience with Python-based frameworks for machine learning.
Proficiency in TensorFlow and/or PyTorch for model development and deployment.
Strong knowledge of Scikit-learn for machine learning model implementation.
In-depth understanding of supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, as well as deep learning architectures.


Nice To Have


Experience with Keras for quick prototyping of deep learning models.
Proficiency in Pandas and Numpy for data manipulation and preprocessing.
Familiarity with Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications in AI.
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills.


Skills: numpy,pandas,keras,k-nn,algorithms,tensorflow,data science,rnns,random forest,unsupervised learning,decision trees,gans,svm,pytorch,learning,python,supervised learning,reinforcement learning,deep learning,cnns,ml,scikit-learn,transfer learning,large language models (llms),machine learning

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
As an Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right ML solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.

Responsibilities

  • Develop AI applications using state-of-the-art (Gen)AI technology;
  • Translate business requests into AI applications;
  • Identify high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization;
  • Pilot prototypes in production processes to demonstrate their value;
  • Deploy prototypes to production, with support of IT, to obtain reliable, scalable systems;
  • Present your results in a clear manner and discuss them with multi-functional project teams;
  • Work in close collaboration with business experts (e.g. for requirement gathering, data source identification, data and process understanding, feature engineering, result validation, etc.), with IT (e.g. for ETL, deployment to production, etc.) and with other AI engineers in the team (e.g. for knowledge sharing).


Profile

  • PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.)
  • 3+ years of relevant work experience in a business environment


Technical Skills

  • Hands-on experience with Python and its AI ecosystem;
  • Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art AI and statistical methods;
  • Experience with cloud technology (Azure);
  • Experience using LLM’s and commonly used libraries to interact with LLM’s (Langchain, Llamaindex, ...);
  • Proven proficiency in the end-to-end AI project life cycle, including:
  • Translating business requests into data requirements.
  • Identifying high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.
  • Developing AI solutions (incl. feature engineering, model fitting, etc.).
  • Deploying scalable AI applications to production.
  • Any experience with following elements is a big plus:
  • MLOps practices, e.g. orchestration with Airflow, Gitlab CI/CD, etc.
  • Containerized deployment of ML products – e.g. docker, podman, Kubernetes


Attitudes/Behavior

  • Passionate about AI and a constant learner;
  • Result-oriented and highly proficient in transforming data into actionable insights that create business value;
  • Team player with strong communication and presentation skills;
  • Able to manage AI projects in an autonomous way and drive collaboration with domain experts, data engineers and other AI engineers;
  • Knowledge in the field of telecommunications is a plus.


Languages

  • Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) + Fluent in English.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Client: European Dynamics

Position: Data Scientist

Location: Brussels, Belgium

Rate: Open for discussion


Job Description:


We currently have a vacancy for a Data Scientist fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert who will be based in Brussels, Belgium. The work will be carried out either in the company’s premises or on site at customer premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client’s IT team on site.


Your tasks

  • Collect business requirement and develop advanced data mining solutions;
  • Identify, assess and deploy relevant existing data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solution;
  • Specification and design of presentation interfaces with optimal usability/user experience;
  • Identify, collect, convert and update different data types/sets in several locations (e.g. ETL);
  • Produce data models according to specific problems statements;
  • Scripting and programming;
  • Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack (including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions etc…);
  • Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as necessary to address cross-project interdependencies.

Requirements

  • University degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 17 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Experience in Azure;
  • Experience in using the suite of PowerApps;
  • Experience with languages like R, Python, PERL;
  • Experience in data visualization using power BI;
  • Excellent knowledge of Power app developer, low code and no code development;
  • Excellent knowledge of Data Analytics techniques and tools;
  • Excellent knowledge of continuous code delivery and unit testing;
  • Excellent knowledge of SharePoint Online;
  • Good knowledge of business intelligence tools (Tableau, SAS, SAP, GoodData…);
  • Good knowledge of ETL processes and tools (i.e. Talend Open Studio…);
  • Good knowledge of SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL);
  • Knowledge of architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores;
  • Knowledge in one of the following areas: predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive (simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, social media crawling and processing, plagiarism detection, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation systems;
  • Certifications in Microsoft Azure would be considered an asset;
  • Excellent command of the English language.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description:

o You have 5+ years of work experience with Python, and AI/ML standard libraries such as pandas, scikit-learn, xgboost

 Nice-to-haves:

 Data processing libraries and frameworks (pydantic, pandera)

 Web frameworks (such as FastAPI, Flask, ...)

 CLI frameworks (Typer, Click, ...)

 General MLOps tools and frameworks (MLFlow, Azure ML Studio, ...)

 Version control tools for ML datasets and models (DVC, Azure ML Dataset, ...)

 Monitoring libraries and solutions (such as NannyML, Evidently AI, ...)

 Distributed processing libraries and frameworks (such as Ray, Dask, PySpark, ...)

 Pipeline-building and orchestration libraries (such as Metaflow, ZenML, Kedro, Airflow, Dagster, ...)

 General Python development tool (pytest, coverage, tox, mypy, black, ruff, uv, pip-compile, ...)

o You can write both object-oriented and functional code, and understand concepts such as (de)coupling, coherence, inheritance, composition.

o You make sure the code that you and your colleagues write is thoroughly tested (unit, integration, end-to-end, stress/performance).

o You love and regularly use data validation and type hints.

o You know how to turn a messy jupyter notebook into a production-grade piece of code.

 Although we'll apply all possible preventive measure to prevent this from ever happening.

o You know how to package a python application or library for distribution

o You are a proficient GIT user, able to collaborate with multiple developers on multiple repositories, while following best practices related to branching, merging and code reviews.

• You have a good understanding of Machine Learning algorithms and their applications in NLP.

• You have work experience with at least one Cloud Provider, preferably Azure Cloud.

• You have experience with Unix/Linux command line tools and scripting (shell, bash):

o VIP club membership if you have at least once ran `rm -rf` on production data.

• You possess the foundational Data Engineering skills, allowing you to interact with the Data Engineering team, and analyze and troubleshoot data pipelines if needed:

o You could handle using SQL to extract, transform and load data (ETL/ELT).

o Experience with the Hadoop ecosystem (Spark, Kafka, Hive, Impala…) is a plus.

 Experience with the Cloudera distribution is an additional plus

• You understand the modern MLOps framework and complexities it adds to DevOps.

o You are able to identify the MLOps maturity gaps and provide inputs for modernization efforts.

Non-technical

• You have strong verbal and written communication skills as well as good customer relationship skills to present complex concepts and/or the results of a use case to different audiences (from end users up to division management).

• You have experience of working in large, complex enterprises and have stoically accepted it as your fate.

• You are not allergic to legacy technology, yet are always on the lookout for modernization opportunities.

• You stay up-to-date with new tools, technologies and approaches within the domain.

• You are a well-integrated team player.

• You are able to estimate your short-term effort with reasonable accuracy and get the work done in the time frame you commit to.

• You successfully swim in the waters of Agile project management techniques (scrum boards, standups, demos, reviews).

• You stand to promote MLOps and advocate for its usage and necessity across the organization.

• Must love mentoring and sharing knowledge.

• University degree in software engineering OR Data Science/Machine Learning/Data Engineering OR a related quantitative field, combined with strong IT skills.

• 5+ years of experience with Python

• 2+ years of experience of using DevOps/CI/CD practices.

• 2+ years of experience in deploying AI solutions to production

Show more

Title: Data Scientist (BRUXELLES – BELGIO)
HTML:
NETtoWORK, azienda italiana nata nel 2016, operante nel settore dei servizi, si occupa di soddisfare le necessità dei clienti offrendo servizi personalizzati.

Il nostro team si avvale anche di consulenti esperti nel settore, per supportare il cliente durante il periodo di collaborazione.

Posizione:

Stiamo cercando un Data Scientist per il team del nostro cliente a Bruxelles in Belgio.

La posizione è on-site con la possibilità di lavoro remoto dopo un primo periodo di prova da concordare.

Compiti e responsabilità:

  • Raccogliere i requisiti aziendali e sviluppare soluzioni avanzate di data mining;
  • Identificare, valutare e distribuire soluzioni di data mining, machine learning e business intelligence esistenti e pertinenti;
  • Specificare e progettare interfacce di presentazione con usabilità/esperienza utente ottimali;
  • Identificare, raccogliere, convertire e aggiornare diversi tipi/set di dati in diverse posizioni (ad esempio ETL);
  • Produrre modelli di dati in base a specifiche dichiarazioni di problemi;
  • Scripting e programmazione;
  • Contribuire alla progettazione e all’implementazione dell’architettura di analisi e del suo stack di soluzioni (inclusi aspetti delle prestazioni, progettazione fisica, dimensioni della capacità, ecc.);
  • Scrivere la diversa documentazione associata ai compiti e collaborare con altri team di progetto, se necessario, per affrontare le interdipendenze tra progetti.

È richiesta la conoscenza operativa della lingua inglese parlata e scritta (B2), l’attività lavorativa si svolgerà prettamente in inglese in quanto la risorsa dovrà interagire con gruppi di lavoro internazionali/multiculturali.

Completano il profilo: autonomia, proattività e problem solving.

Contratto: dipendente / freelance

Requisiti:

Si richiede:

  • Laurea in informatica o disciplina pertinente, almeno 10 anni di esperienza lavorativa pertinente in informatica;
  • Esperienza nell’uso della suite di PowerApps;
  • Esperienza con linguaggi come R, Python, PERL;
  • Esperienza nella visualizzazione dei dati tramite Power BI;
  • Ottima conoscenza di Power app developer, low code e sviluppo senza codice;
  • Ottima conoscenza di tecniche e strumenti di analisi dei dati;
  • Ottima conoscenza dei processi di CI/CD e unit testing;
  • Ottima conoscenza di SharePoint Online;
  • Buona conoscenza di strumenti di business intelligence (Tableau, SAS, SAP, GoodData…);
  • Buona conoscenza di processi e strumenti ETL (ad es. Talend Open Studio…);
  • Buona conoscenza di strumenti SQL (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL);
  • Conoscenza della progettazione architettonica e implementazione di archivi dati moderni scalabili;
  • Conoscenza in una delle seguenti aree: predittiva (previsione, raccomandazione), prescrittiva (simulazione), analisi del sentiment, rilevamento degli argomenti, scansione ed elaborazione dei social media, rilevamento del plagio, rilevamento di tendenze/anomalie nei set di dati, sistemi di raccomandazione;
  • Le certificazioni in Microsoft Azure saranno considerate un vantaggio;

Title: Data Scientist - Global Payments & Fraud Management
Description:
Why PlayStation?

PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.

PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.

The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.

Role overview:

Interested in working on strategic initiatives that allow for creativity and room for growth? Do you have strong passion for using data and cutting-edge technologies to drive the best business decisions? If so, read on…

Sony Interactive Entertainment’s (SIE) Global Fraud Management and Global Payment (GPFM) Teams are the guardians of both customer trust and purchase success for PlayStation and the PlayStation® Network (PSN). We provide innovative solutions to support every element of the network, various platform services, customer service teams, a diverse developer community, and more.

We recently launched a next generation risk platform and machine learning framework that support the global, fast-growing PlayStation® Network customer base, world class PlayStation® consoles, hand-held devices, PlayStation® TV, and many more! In doing so, the ability to extract information from data and drive action that help achieve business goals is essential. GPFM’s Data Science team is responsible for evaluating online user activity data for potential fraud across this new platform. Our job is to provide quantitative assessments of all customers and identify those individuals who pose the most risk to our businesses.

What you'll be doing:


Utilise various approaches to maximise value from predictive analytics solutions.
Optimise use of developed Machine-Learning algorithms in conjunction with other aspects of decision logic (rules, other models, etc.)
Demonstrate understanding of predictive modelling methodology that detect fraud and other ecommerce risks.
Provide feedback to modellers on new features, algos, strategy, and modelling ideas.
Conduct robust statistical analysis to big data using hypothesis testing, design of experiment, inferential statistics, and more.
Improve decision performance by analysing misclassification cases, hit rates, and customer feedback.
Coordinate, document and simplify rule assessment.
Develop deep understanding of business challenges and recommend data features and functionality that can contribute to identifying risk and possible fraud.
Assist the Software Development and Peer team members in testing and deploying decision changes (rules, models, etc.) on the newly created platform.


What we're looking for:


Master’s degree in Statistics, Operations Research, Machine Learning, Computer Science or other related fields
2+ years working with statistical modelling techniques (Classification, Regression, CHAID, Neural Networks, Cluster Analysis, RFs, XGBs, etc.).
Hands-on statistical analysis experience with some understanding of a statistical programming package such as R/Python/Java/other is required, and some visualization applications using Tableau/R Shiny/Python Dash.
Experience performing large scale data manipulation to assess, clean, merge, and analyses large data sets from different data warehouse sources (Hive, Hadoop, MySQL, SQL, Snowflake, etc.).
A passion for analysing highly complex data sets, an entrepreneurial spirit, a relentless customer-focus, a practical understanding of quantitative methods, and superb attention to detail.


Desirable skills:


Demonstrable experience working with Optimisation, statistical analysis, machine learning or text classification algorithms.
Solid understanding of predictive modelling, data manipulation, unstructured data processing, and data value assessment.
Creation and understanding of macros for automating above mentioned processes is strongly preferred!


Please refer to our Candidate Privacy Notice for more information about how we process your personal information, and your data protection rights

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category.

We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.

PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
DT Services and Consulting is a company dedicated to all projects related to continuous improvement, with a a focus on proactivity, polyvalence, and autonomy. Founded in 2019 by Thibault Draye in Liège, DTSC can offer to their clients the most dedicated service in Continuous Improvement project. We now serve customers all over the BeNeLux and France. In this context, we are continuously looking for new profiles to strengthen our teams.




Main responsibilities

Utilize advanced data mining and machine learning techniques to analyze large datasets and extract

actionable insights.

Develop predictive models, algorithms, and statistical analyses to solve complex business problems

and drive decision-making.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for leveraging data to improve

processes, products, and services.

Design and implement data visualization dashboards and reports to communicate findings and

recommendations to stakeholders.

Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies in data science and analytics,

incorporating new tools and methodologies as appropriate.

Drive innovation and continuous improvement in data science practices, contributing to the

development of best practices and standards within the organization.




Qualifications

Master's or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in a Data Scientist or similar role, with a proven track record of

delivering impactful insights and solutions.

Expertise in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL for data manipulation, analysis, and

modeling.

Proficiency in machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, scikit-learn, or

PyTorch.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into

actionable insights.

Excellent communication and presentation skills, with fluency in English, Dutch, and French

(preferred).

Entrepreneurial mindset with a passion for driving innovation and delivering value to clients.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, managing

multiple projects simultaneously.




Our Offer

A competitive and evolutive salary package including company car and benefits depending on your specific needs and your experience
Because of our flexible working hours and homeworking possibilities you can say goodbye to traffic jams
We will provide all the tools necessary to be successful in your job and foresee the necessary training so you can grow in your career
Depending on your clients and preferences your main workplace will be Brussels or Liège with potential regular commute to the client location
“A laugh a day keeps the doctor away!” Our employees work hard but they also play hard, hello afterwork drinks, company dinners, company day…
We have an informal atmosphere with challenging international projects, the best of both worlds!




Do you have the right balance of scientific rigor and an entrepreneurial mindset?

Please send us your CV, academic records/portfolio and motivation letter at applications@dtsc.be

Title: Data Scientist Banking
Description:
About the job




Are you a data whiz with a passion for using your skills to drive impactful business decisions? Do you thrive in a dynamic consulting environment where collaboration and innovation are paramount?

If you're a data scientist with 3-5 years of experience and a desire to propel businesses forward, then Sailpeak wants to hear from you! We're seeking a talented individual to join our team and play a crucial role in helping our clients unlock the power of their data.




About Sailpeak




Sailpeak is a leading management consulting firm based in the heart of Europe (Brussels), dedicated to guiding businesses through transformative moments of both challenge and opportunity. Our team collaborates with a diverse range of organizations, from startups to multinational giants, primarily focusing on Financial Services. Together, we design and implement cutting-edge solutions that foster growth, sustainability, and success.




Role and Responsibilities




In this role, you'll be a key member of our team, partnering with consultants and founders to leverage data for strategic decision-making. Your responsibilities will include:




Drive data-driven insights: Analyze complex data sets to uncover actionable insights that inform strategic decision-making.
Develop cutting-edge solutions: Lead ambitious projects by developing innovative applications based on LLMs and other advanced technologies.
Mentor and grow talent: Guide and mentor a team of junior data scientists to foster their professional development.
Collaborate with clients: Partner with consultants and executives to understand business objectives and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Stay ahead of the curve: Continuously learn and apply new data science techniques to remain at the forefront of the field.




Requirements




Master's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field
3-5 years of experience working as a Data Scientist or similar role.
Strong experience in programming languages like Python (including libraries like pandas, scikit-learn, etc.), SQL and/or Matlab
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) is a plus.
Proven ability to design, build, and deploy machine learning models.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex data insights to a non-technical audience.
Collaborative mindset with a passion for teamwork.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Fluency in English and in French or Dutch.
Candidates must have the legal right to work in the EU without requiring visa sponsorship




Benefits




Joining Sailpeak as a Data Scientist in Banking offers:

The opportunity to collaborate with top-tier banking clients, gaining exposure to diverse financial industries.
Mentorship and guidance from experienced Directors and Partners with backgrounds from renowned companies like Google, PayPal, Semetis, and Sia Partners.
Continuous opportunities for learning and professional development.
A vibrant and inclusive workplace culture that values individual contributions and teamwork.
Competitive compensation package.




How to Apply




If you're ready to take the next step in your career with Sailpeak, apply for the position of Data Scientist Banking by sending the following to careers@sailpeak.com:

Your up-to-date CV/resume.
A cover letter outlining your interest in the role and your relevant qualifications.
Details of any academic or professional achievements or projects.




Chart a course toward a transformative career at Sailpeak today!

Title: Data Scientist (base in Vienna)
Description:
Our client is an Austrian Fintech company specialised in Big Data, Low Latency and Trend Forecasting for the FX and crypto market.




Looking to fill the role of a data scientists with a focus on developing statistical and machine learning models in FX applications.




Main responsibilities :

Support the data science team: Data aggregation, generation of insights, modelling.

Development of statistics models / ML models for a range of FX use cases.

Willingness to learn new languages and frameworks to identify the tools best suited for the objective.




Required experience :

Actual experience in statistics (beyond simple models)

Development of machine learning models

SQL, Python




Desired experience :

Background in natural sciences, math, information science or other statistics-adjacent fields

Kafka; stream processing

Collaboration in development teams: Git, CI/CD,

Timeseries databases / OLTP / OLAP

Spark/Scala

Experience in high frequency finance / FX




Job base in Vienna or Bratislava (according to your preference).

Salary range : 50,000€ - 55,000€ gross per year

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
ITMAGINATION helps its Clients by becoming a true extension of their software and data development capabilities. Through the readily set up, comprehensive, and self-governing teams, we let our Clients focus on their business while we make sure that their software products and data tools scale up accordingly and with outstanding quality.

We are looking for experienced team players to fill the Data Scientist position and participate in our up-and-coming project for our client from the pharmaceutical industry.

You can expect:


Collaborating with a talented and motivated team professionals
Involvement in impactful projects that drive business success

Strong programming skills in Python or R
Experience with data manipulation and processing
Proficiency in NLP and working with LLMs

Benefits

Possibility of 20 business days off each year
Professional training programs – including Udemy and other development plans
Benefits package offer - Health Insurance, Sports Package, and Life Insurance offerings
Work with a team that’s recognized for its excellence. We’ve been featured in the Deloitte Technology Fast 50 & FT 1000 rankings. We’ve also received the Great Place To Work® certification for five years in a row

Title: Data Scientist (H/F)
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment.




For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 40 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions – we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and production.




You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Science solutions
Going into production with Data Engineers
Creation of POC, model development
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?

You have a Master in engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics…) and you have some experiences as a Data Scientist !
You have bases in the realization of POC, the development of models and applications starting from- scratch as well as in the putting into production
You master programming best practices such as code versionning (git), IDE use (PyCharm fore.g.), testing, use of CI/CD tools
You are fully proficient in Python, Machine learning & Deep learning frameworks (Scikit-Learn & Tensorflow for e.g.) and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
You are familiar with some of the following domains: time series, NLP, Computer Vision, reinforcement learning, IoT
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

Title: AI Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist - Freelance - €45 per hour




For our international client we are looking for a Data Scientist to join an international project with our customer.




Project details:

• Start: ASAP

• Duration: 6 month (+ option to extend)

• Workload: 5 days a week

• Location: Remote

• Language: English




Responsibilities:




• In-depth experience in data modelling and using data analytically tools and techniques (e.g., Python, SQL, Hadoop, R, Data Bricks)

• Understanding of vector databases

• In-depth experience with statistical models and data mining algorithms

• Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques such as Natural Language Processing / Text Analytics, Random Forest, Boosting, etc.

• Experience in using advanced machine learning algorithms and models such as: classification, regression, clustering, decision trees, etc.

• Coding knowledge and experience with several languages: Python, C, C++, Java, etc.

• Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) skills

• Understanding of cloud computing and data privacy concepts

• Ability to understand business requirements and project objectives

• Ability to understand and analyze use case data

• Ability to prepare and organize data for data modelling

• Evaluation skills. Assess quality and robustness of models to meet business objectives and adjust models.

• Deployment skills. Deploy models and share results with stakeholders.

• Ability to manage data lakes end to end from creation to maintenance

Contract length: 6-12 Months

Must-Have

Total Years Of exp- 7+ years experience mandatory

Solid understanding of cloud services, including Azure, GCP, or AWS

We are seeking experienced professionals with expertise in Large Language Models (LLM) to join a dynamic team working on next-generation products. In this role, you will collaborate with other engineers across various skill sets, driving innovative solutions for our clients.

7+ years of professional experience in building Machine Learning models & systems
1+ years of hands-on experience with LLMs and Generative AI, particularly prompt engineering, RAG, and agents
Expertise in business analysis, requirement gathering, and solution workflow design for GenAI/ML projects
Proven ability to drive client engagement and align development teams toward a technical roadmap
Proficient in programming with Python, Langchain, and SQL
Solid understanding of cloud services, including Azure, GCP, or AWS
Excellent communication skills for effective collaboration with business SMEs

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Middle / Senior)
Description:
Company Intro




Toloka AI is a global tech company that offers end-to-end data labeling solutions based on the effective combination of public crowd, domain experts and ML. Toloka has one of the most advanced annotation platforms in the market together with huge experience gathered by the whole team. Our solutions are powered by the most diverse global crowd from 100+ countries speaking 40+ languages and extensive experience in the practical application of SOTA models.




We bring together talents from all over the world to form our team of professionals. Our team is globally distributed and works from several locations, including the USA, the Netherlands, Israel, Czech Republic, Serbia, and more.




We need an experienced and vigorous ML Engineer who will get the job done and enrich our team with knowledge, expertise, and experience.




Project Examples




Automating labeling quality control for collecting SFT (Supervised Fine-Tuning) datasets, focusing on challenges like instruction-following, logical consistency, and factual accuracy.
Building AI-assistants for labelers to streamline tasks like data annotation, evaluation, and quality assurance.
Researching and implementing strategies to optimize labeling order, speeding up model training cycles.
Generating and validating synthetic datasets for training models.




Responsibilities




Perform data exploration on human-labeled datasets generated from complex labeling pipelines.
Prototype and evaluate different approaches, such as prompt engineering, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), fine-tuning pre-trained models, and training models from scratch.
Develop and deploy production-ready solutions.
Implement evaluation metrics and pipelines to measure model performance.
Stay up-to-date with the latest research and open-source models in the ML community.
Work closely with non-technical team members to translate business needs into technical solutions.




Optional Skills and Experience




Experience with fine-tuning and evaluating large language models.
Hands-on experience in collecting human-labeled datasets and evaluation pipelines.
Fluency in English.




Team Philosophy




We are business-value focused, so hacking your way to solving problems is praised.
We work in a fast-paced environment, valuing quick decision-making, rapid iteration, and learning from mistakes.
Delivering top-tier data to our clients is central to our mission, so rigorously evaluating models is a big part of the job.
Overworking is not encouraged, so we focus on building low-cost/high-impact solutions that are sustainable and reusable.
ML components are part of larger data pipelines, so stepping outside your immediate scope and engaging with people outside the team can bring significant value.




Qualifications




Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
3+ years of industry experience in Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
Strong engineering skills with proficiency in Python, SQL, and commonly used ML frameworks/libraries.
Solid understanding of machine learning fundamentals, including algorithms, model evaluation, and data preprocessing.
Experience in NLP (Natural Language Processing) or Computer Vision (CV).
Proficiency in English (B2+)




What we can offer




Personal and career development: we support employee’s ambition for professional development and encourage them to implement their ideas in their projects;
Flexibility: we offer remote or hybrid employment. You will also design with your manager a workday that works best for you;
Paid parental leave + Annual vacation policy;
Transportation expenses reimbursement;
Meal allowance for every working day in the office;
Contributions to personal pension plan.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Description

We currently have a vacancy for a Data Scientist fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert remotely. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client’s IT team.

Your Tasks

  • Coordination and review of policy units’ business needs;
  • Carry out ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) tasks;
  • Creating, designing and developing data models;
  • Analyze large datasets and propose approaches for optimization of reporting;
  • Assessment and quality control of data;
  • Preparation of statistical analysis of data for use by policy officers and other stakeholders;
  • Management and processing of data;
  • Reporting of key indicators for different policy fields on the basis of data sets available;
  • Development and maintenance of interactive dashboards in Power BI;
  • Assistance with data management aspects of IT projects.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with 5 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Excellent knowledge of Data Analytics techniques and tools;
  • Very good knowledge of reporting and statistics;
  • Good knowledge of Power BI;
  • Experience with one or more of the following: Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing, Languages like R, Python, PERL, Other business intelligence tools (Tableau, SAS, SAP, GoodData…), ETL processes and tools (i.e. Talend Open Studio…);
  • Knowledge of SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL);
  • Knowledge of architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores;
  • Knowledge in one of the following areas: predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive (simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, social media crawling and processing, plagiarism detection, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation systems;
  • Excellent command of the English language.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
GigsRemote connects trusted companies with top tech contractors from Central and Eastern Europe, bringing them together to work on IT projects of varying complexity and duration. Our aim is to create an ongoing opportunity for gig talent allowing them to work from any location and set their own work-life balance focusing on projects they feel passionate about.




For one of our clients, we are looking for an AI Engineer on B2B contract.




Our client is focused on delivering scalable solutions, with accent on high quality and applying top-notch technologies. Proven experience with commercial AI projects is essential success in this project.




In this role you will be:

Collaborating closely with the team to design and develop AI proof of concepts and prototypes,
Create scalable version of the solution for successful POC.




You need to have:

Proven experience on a commercial AI project, preferably within energy sector,
Senior level of expertise in Python,
Experience with Llama Index and/or LangChain,
Experience in applying LLM,
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills,
Excellent English language skills.




We offer short-term (two months) B2B contract, with potential to extend. This can be a full- or part-time remote role with working hours flexibility. Only contractors based in Europe will be considered.




If you are interested, apply here or sign-up on our website and our Talent Advisor will get in touch with you to discuss further process.

We offer short-term (two months) B2B contract, with potential to extend. This can be a full- or part-time remote role with working hours flexibility. Only contractors based in Europe will be considered.


If you are interested, apply here or sign-up on our website and our Talent Advisor will get in touch with you to discuss further process.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
RED Global is currently recruiting for a Machine Learning Engineer - AI for our client, a global organisation who undertaking a large complex digital transformation program. They are looking to bring on board an experienced ML Engineer – AI with extensive experience of Machine Learning, Generative AI, Solution architecture and Data Science platforms.

Key responsibilities:

Responsible to define and implement best practices for building, testing, and deploying scalable AI solutions with a strong focus on generative models and LLM.
Design and implement solutions with the use of ML and Generative AI tools and technologies, with a strong focus on end-to-end automation.
Accountable to build and design cloud hosted generative AI solutions.
Work closely with customers to identify issues and support them in implementation of their ML ecosystem.
Develop Solutions to ensure robust and secure data pipelines and infrastructure to support AI model training and deployment.
Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in Generative AI and Machine Learning.
Lead the evaluation of new AI tools, frameworks, and methodologies.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Dutch or French with good senior level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.




Required skills:

4+ years’ experience in designing and building AI solutions.
Hands on expertise in ML techniques, deep learning frameworks, image processing and AI-related technologies including Generative AI.
Previous worked across various cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure.
Must have experience of using data science platforms such as Databricks, AzureML, SageMaker and frameworks such as TensorFlow or similar.
Good knowledge of DevOps, MLOps, DataOps and LLMOps principles.
Native Dutch or French speaker and professional working proficiency in English.

I am excited to be partnered with an extremely exciting AI start up who are building an innovative AI content generation platform.




Being supported by some of the best contributors to LLMs & Opensource AI they have already secured multiple $M of funding and are on track to scale significantly in the next year.




They currently have 13 members within the team and are currently looking to add another Python engineer into the team.

Experience with open source projects




Benefits

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to apply Data, ML & GenAI technology to create meaningful impact with digital products at scale, solve the needs of its users and tackle real-world problems in the world of digital & business? Are you up for the challenge to scale AI applications to hundred thousands of users, balancing best engineering practices and continuous user feedback? Then the role of a Senior Machine Learning Engineer will definitely trigger your interest!

In The Pocket's mission is to create digital products that make people happy and businesses grow. We believe both aspects are crucial for successful digital products, and they will often drive one another. Generative AI, Machine Learning & Data technologies allow us to improve both: by improving the experience of existing products, by enabling new business models based on newly uncovered insights and by enabling a whole range of new digital products with new value streams. Let's leverage ML & data to build even better digital products.







What you’ll do:

You'll closely collaborate with ML Engineers, Product Managers, Architects, and Software Engineers to define, implement and improve use cases that are enabled through machine learning. You are responsible for the life-cycle of the AI solution. This includes designing, developing testing, improving deploying and scaling the model that is used. There will be a focus on MLOps and the ability to scale modern NLP applications both in amount of users and data. But you don't do this in a vacuum. Rather, you're part of a multidisciplinary team where every member is equally responsible for the product's success
You keep up with the latest Data, Machine Learning & Generative AI advances, with a particular focus on what might be applicable in our context. In particular, your enthusiasm for "what is possible" motivates you and we expect you to transfer that enthusiasm to your team members and even our clients
You actively participate in knowledge sharing both towards peers (lessons learned, new advances, process improvements,..) as well as other people in our organisation (e.g. sales, marketing, product, strategy...). And it doesn't have to stop there: we happily support any initiatives to share our findings with the world, through blogs, talks, podcasts or guest lectures
You clearly communicate and set expectations. What realistic results can be expected? What are the greatest risks/unknowns? Always be open and honest, and don't be afraid to ask for help







Who you are:

You hold a bachelor/master/PhD degree in Computer Science (or related), and a master in Data Science / AI / Statistics or Machine Learning - or you have a proven track record in a similar role
You have a profound knowledge of Python and at least one of the most important machine learning frameworks (Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Keras, Pytorch,...) and are able to work AI platforms like Huggingface, replicate and/or AI cloud services like Vertex AI Studio, AWS Sagemaker or Azure AI Studio
You have relevant experience in going beyond running local ML experiments, but bringing ML to production, including MLOps, Data versioning, & LLM Orchestration frameworks
You have a broad awareness of the possibilities and limitations of ML, and see how Data and ML can help us build even better products for our clients.
You have an affinity with product design and engineering top-notch digital products
You highly value the principles of clean code, continuous improvement and rapid prototyping. Experience with continuous delivery and/or devops practices is a plus
Any experience with the broader services from Google Cloud Platform, AWS or Azure is a plus
You excel in sharing your knowledge with others, you enjoy coaching team members and helping them to gain more insights in your field of expertise







Additional information:

Working at In The Pocket means accepting a high level of autonomy. We rely on trust and openness, and sharing our learning curve. At In The Pocket, there’s time to experiment and budget to develop yourself.




On a personal level, we’re looking for someone who shares our values:




Ownership: Working at In The Pocket means accepting a high level of autonomy. You take ownership and show the ability to decide and act for the good of the company
Integrity: Stick to your values, even when it doesn’t pay off in the short term. In The Pocket relies on trust and openness, which in turn relies on your integrity
Lead & Educate: Digital technologies are changing the world. We go all in, head-first. We take the lead in designing and building with emerging technologies. We share our passion and knowledge with as many people as possible.
Agility: In The Pocket is permanently under construction. We never settle, it’s never done. Observing, adapting and improving is in our nature. That resonates with the people who work here. We are always looking for a better solution, always ready for the next step, pragmatic and committed to moving forward
Team: As individuals, we are bright and talented, as a team we are unbeatable. We are open and positive, constructive and honest. We help and inspire our colleagues to do their best work.
Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer (Contract)




We are looking for an AI Engineer with a strong foundation in AI, Machine Learning, and Computer Vision. This role centers around creating and fine-tuning advanced algorithms for edge devices, including integrating neural network models with embedded cameras and specialized processors.




Responsibilities:

Develop and implement advanced algorithms for embedded cameras
Optimize AI models for edge devices
Document and share insights with the global AI team




Requirements:

4+ years in Data Science, AI, or related fields
Strong communication skills
Proficiency in C++ and experience with ML Ops, DevOps, and AI solutions
Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
VIATRIS BV

At VIATRIS, we see healthcare not as it is but as it should be. We act courageously and are uniquely positioned to be a source of stability in a world of evolving healthcare needs.

Viatris empowers people worldwide to live healthier at every stage of life.

We do so via:

Access – Providing high quality trusted medicines regardless of geography or circumstance;

Leadership – Advancing sustainable operations and innovative solutions to improve patient health; and

Partnership – Leveraging our collective expertise to connect people to products and services.

Every day, we rise to the challenge to make a difference and here’s how the Data Scientist role will make an impact:

Key Responsibilities for This Role Include:

Enhancing the advancement of CRM systems through the integration of AI technologies, the Data Scientist will support strategic decision-making by leveraging advanced data analytics, predictive models, and machine learning, ultimately enhancing business intelligence and operational efficiency.


Implement and integrate new versions and functionalities of existing CRM systems, in collaboration with Regional and Global teams, to bring system capabilities to the next level.
Manage and optimize the existing CRM systems to ensure accurate and up-to-date customer data.
Ensure that data management procedures are up-to-date and provide end-users training on CRM functionalities.
Analyse large and complex datasets using AI techniques to identify patterns and deliver insights for strategic decision-making.
Develop and implement predictive models, machine learning algorithms, and AI-driven statistical analyses to support the transformation of business operations.
Perform regular data audits to identify and rectify inaccuracies or inconsistencies, ensuring higher data quality.
Create and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualizations to communicate insights and performance metrics to internal stakeholders.



The minimum qualifications for this role are:


Master’s degree in Data Science, Business Management, Marketing or a related field.
Minimum 3-5 years experience in supporting the business goals and needs.
Fluent in FR and/or NL, with strong EN capabilities
In-depth knowledge of CRM systems (Salesforce, Veeva)
Good understanding of programming languages (Python, R, Java, or others)
Experience with Power BI
Experience in data management and model development
Strong business acumen and capability to translate business requirements into data modelling.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.



At Viatris, we offer competitive salaries, benefits and an inclusive environment where you can use your experiences, perspectives and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others.

Viatris is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms and cybersecurity. By combining creativity, tech and data insights, we empower our customers to transform their business and unlock the future. With 25 years’ experience and 10,000 employees across Europe, the Middle East and Africa, Devoteam promotes responsible tech for people and works to create better change.

Join our global community of exceptional talents at Devoteam, where you’ll collaborate with multidisciplinary teams of data specialists, product designers, business consultants, security experts, cloud engineers, developers, and more across over 20 countries in the EMEA region. As a member of our team, you’ll have the opportunity to work with the world’s leading partners, including AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow, driving innovation and advancing your career.


Job Description

Are you passionate about data-driven platforms, machine learning models, and innovative applications? As a Data Scientist/Engineer at Devoteam, you'll play a hands-on role in delivering impactful solutions across various clients and industries. Each mission we undertake has clear deliverables and deadlines, ensuring you gain diverse experience. For example, one month you might develop a predictive maintenance model, and the next, a customer segmentation model for a retail client.

Key Responsibilities:

Platform Setup: Design and implement robust data platforms using Azure, AWS or Google Cloud and Databricks.
Data Management: Gather, prepare, and manage data for analysis.
Model Research: Investigate and select appropriate machine learning models.
ML Modeling: Develop and refine machine learning models.
Client Collaboration: Spend approximately 50% of your time working directly with clients, either independently or as part of a team.



Your Role:

Build and maintain data platforms and pipelines using Azure, AWS or Google Cloud, Databricks, and Python.
Develop predictive and machine learning models tailored to client needs.
Advise clients on translating their business requirements into technical solutions using machine learning techniques.
Stay updated on the latest trends in machine learning and AI, sharing insights with clients.
Act as a strategic partner to client Data Science teams, helping them navigate their challenges and aspirations.
Inspire clients with new data-driven opportunities.
Bring best practices in Git, DevOps, and CICD to enhance client data platforms.
Collaborate with Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Business Stakeholders.
Represent Devoteam both online and offline, showcasing our expertise.


Qualifications

About You:

Reside in Belgium.
Hold a university degree in Computer Science, (Business) Engineering, or a specialized master's in Machine Learning or AI.
Have a solid understanding of various machine learning models (e.g., SVM, RNN, Deep Learning) and their applications.
Possess foundational knowledge of Data Science, including sampling techniques and evaluation metrics.
Proficient in SQL and Python.
Experience with Spark and/or cloud ecosystems is a must.
Eager to learn and passionate about data and machine learning technologies.
Excited to join a dynamic and growing team.
Fluent in English; proficiency in Dutch or French is mandatory 



 


Additional Information

Why choose us?

Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.
Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it’s okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.
Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.
Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.
Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.
Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation. 
Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.

At Devoteam, we combine strong values – respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.

>>> Does all this sound compelling to you? Go for it and click that apply button!
