Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Healthcare Experience
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer - Healthcare Experience




Are you passionate about advancing ML while protecting privacy? 🔒🧠




We're partnering with a cutting-edge company pioneering federated learning and privacy-preserving AI solutions. They're seeking an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to join their innovative team.




🌟 Key Requirements:

4+ years industrial ML experience
Proficiency in model training and implementation from scratch
Strong Python skills for production-ready code
Collaborative mindset for cross-team projects




🎉 Desirable Skills:

Federated learning experience
Bioscience/healthcare ML background

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for..

a data scientist with a strong knowledge in machine and deep learning to strengthen the activities of our innovation team and Earth Observation activities. GIM uses an open innovation approach to respond flexibly to our rapidly changing ecosystem and to continuously renew our products and services portfolio.







Below you will not find a standard vacancy, you will read a short story about where you will make the difference. Do you want work with us on a society in which geospatial data empower people to live better lives and make better decisions? Get in touch!







As experienced data science professional

I am the driving force behind our Earth Observation AI developments that are used for the further extension of our Belmap product and on customer projects. I actively follow-up new developments and technologies in the data science / machine learning / deep learning & computer vision domains. I provide technical input for research proposals centered around AI for GEO and Earth Observation, and implement the resulting innovation projects.




I contribute to our excellent customer experience by supporting my sales colleagues on their customer visits and contribute to the (pre)sales process by thinking along with the customer, delivering technical advice and giving demos. Together with the team, I translate the customer needs into a concrete project strategy and set up an action plan to ensure the successful delivery of the customer solution. My fluency in Dutch (mandatory!) as well as English, is a big asset in this context. I keep an eye on the project agreements that were made regarding budget, planning and deadlines, and contribute to great project results. My experience with working on complex projects and my excellent communication skills ensure that we create win-win situations with our customers.




I keep up-to-date on the newest technical and scientific developments within the machine learning, Earth Observation and geotechnology domains and share my knowledge with my GIM colleagues. By continuously renewing this technological knowledge and applying it to rapidly evolving customer demands, I also help to ensure that GIMs' products and services portfolio continues to meet the future needs of customers.







What do we offer you?

At GIM we are convinced that employees make the difference. This is why we give them every opportunity to shine in a self-organizing context where we distribute clear areas of responsibility with lots of decision power. We offer you a versatile function in a dynamic and highly innovative company, excellent working conditions and real possibilities for career development. Our salary packages are market conform with excellent fringe benefits, and we give you the choice to opt for a mobility budget, fitting to your personal needs.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
🤖 The Job

Dataroots researches, designs and codes robust AI-solutions & platforms for various sectors, with a strong focus on DataOps and MLOps. As Machine Learning Engineer you are part of our dedicated in-house team of AI-specialists. You excel in building machine learning models which result in our robust and production-ready solutions to optimise company processes.

You love data and turning data inside out to reveal all its secrets. You are an expert in developing and implementing various statistical and machine learning models and you are in charge of controlling the performances of your models output. You love to experiment with different approaches to ensure your client the best-in-class solution. To achieve this, you collaborate closely with our data engineers and/or cloud architects on projects for various sectors, always with a quality focused, end-to-end approach. The result? Our teams provide clients a reliable foundation to make data-driven decisions.

As a senior, you will also build and share knowledge with your colleagues. Through a multitude of initiatives, you have various chances to share your knowledge and keep up to date with the latest developments in the field.




🎉 What you can expect at Dataroots

Dataroots was founded in 2016 and, since its beginnings, has focused on helping its customers achieve excellence in their data-driven operations. The only way to do this sustainably is by investing in team well-being, diversity, knowledge sharing and customer experience. This quality-first focus has allowed sustained and healthy growth over the years. Join a team where you can have an impact on our growth story. Read up more on our DNA over at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].




💪 The Skills

You have a knack for Machine Learning and have attained a Masters or Doctorate in a quantitative field.
You have a strong background and are opinionated on software design principles.
You have at least 2 years experience in a field related to machine learning and big data.
You have a strong theoretical basis and experience in general machine learning & deep learning.
You are excellent in Python. Experience in SQL is a big plus, knowledge of R or Scala is a bonus.
You have an initial experience in deploying ML models and expertise in MLOps.
You have a basic understanding of cloud engineering.
You get excited by large amounts of data.
You approach problems with a pragmatic mindset.
You have strong communication skills and can translate complex solutions into clear and understandable explanations.
You have a good overview over the (big-)data ecosystem.
You speak English and Dutch fluently.




Was this list a bit much? Don't worry, we don't expect you to tick every box from the beginning. Most of all we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us.




💰 The Offer

* An attractive salary package with extralegal benefits such as a company car & fuel card or mobility budget, hospitalisation insurance, group insurance, and a high-end laptop and a smartphone.

* A personal & team training budget to further your professional career.

* Your innovation budget to work on cool, educational, challenging and open-source projects within your guild.

* (Virtual) Team Buildings, team gatherings to let off steam and be part of our sports initiatives.




🇧🇪 Our main offices are in Leuven, Ghent and Utrecht 🇳🇱 , with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These locations are always available for brainstorming sessions or team events. As a Dataroots consultant, much work can be performed remotely, but you will most likely also visit our clients on-site.




Ready for a new chapter as a Machine Learning Engineer at Dataroots? Super! Apply now! 🎉

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Ops Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Ops Engineer - MLOps Engineer

Location – Brussels, Belgium.

Rates- 400 Euro/Day




Excellent work experience with Python, and AI/ML standard libraries such as pandas, scikit-learn, xgboost

Data processing libraries and frameworks (pydantic, pandera)

Web frameworks (such as FastAPI, Flask, ...)

CLI frameworks (Typer, Click, ...)

General MLOps tools and frameworks (MLFlow, Azure ML Studio, ...)

Version control tools for ML datasets and models (DVC, Azure ML Dataset, ...)

Monitoring libraries and solutions (such as NannyML, Evidently AI, ...)

Distributed processing libraries and frameworks (such as Ray, Dask, PySpark, ...)

Pipeline-building and orchestration libraries (such as Metaflow, ZenML, Kedro, Airflow, Dagster, ...)

General Python development tool (pytest, coverage, tox, mypy, black, ruff, uv, pip-compile, ...)

You can write both object-oriented and functional code, and understand concepts such as (de)coupling, coherence, inheritance, composition.

You make sure the code that you and your colleagues write is thoroughly tested (unit, integration, end-to-end, stress/performance).

You love and regularly use data validation and type hints.

You know how to turn a messy jupyter notebook into a production-grade piece of code.

Experience with the Hadoop ecosystem (Spark, Kafka, Hive, Impala…) is a plus.

Experience with the Cloudera distribution is an additional plus

You understand the modern MLOps framework and complexities it adds to DevOps.

You are able to identify the MLOps maturity gaps and provide inputs for modernization efforts.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist (Banking)
Description:
Based on concrete opportunities at our key client, one of the largest banks in Belgium, we are looking to strengthen our transformation team with a new [Junior / Medior / Senior] Data Scientist who will join our Data & Analytics competency.

As a Data Scientist working in financial services, you will support our clients to deliver AI solutions from ideation, feasibility assessment, to data preparation, modelling and industrialization.




Your responsibilities will include:

Proficiently use statistical techniques, machine learning algorithms and data visualization tools to extract valuable insights from the data.
Create value by enabling clients to deliver faster and higher quality service with use of AI solutions.
Ensure seamless communication channels to guarantee accurate integration of complex analytical solutions into the development process.
Collaborate closely with other data scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, and subject matter experts to understand domain-specific challenges and requirements.
Conduct user research, analyze data, and gather feedback from stakeholders.
Maintain a deep understanding of market trends, customer needs, and competitive landscape.




Are you a dynamic and ambitious consultant, eager to be part of a fast growing company that is committed to provide multiple learning opportunities for its talented profiles?




Your skills and attributes:

MS degree in Computer Science, Informatics, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Data Science, or Machine Learning.
Minimum of [1-5] year(s) of hands-on experience with Data Science.
Experience working in Python and SQL.
Experience working with ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face Transformers, etc.
Good understanding of statistical and machine learning models with experience applying your knowledge to business problems.
Have experience in Agile methodologies, preferably in the finance/banking industry.
Are fluent in English and in Dutch or French, with at least a passive knowledge of the other language.




Our offer

Permanent contract with competitive salary package based on market and your experience.
Company car & fuel card, meal voucher, group & hospitalization insurance, bonuses, net allowances + mobile, …
Career and business development opportunities combines with trainings based on your personal needs and ambitions.
Chance to make a real impact on the bank’s compliance efforts.
Flexible working hours
Homeworking policy




Life at Norriq Financial Services

We believe that our employees are our greatest asset, and we are committed to creating a positive and supportive work environment where everyone can thrive

Great Work-life balance
Trainings & growing perspectives (internal mobility)
Variety of social activities/ events/ team buildings
Big 4 culture
Show more

Title: Data & AI Engineer
Description:
As a Data & AI Engineer, you will turn our customers’ ambitions into practical data and AI-driven projects. You are a tech-savvy process enthusiast, skilled in data management, and passionate about tackling intricate challenges. You will dive deep into a project's details to ensure its success.




Location: Main office in Kontich (BE), hubs in Ghent (BE) & Woerden (NL)




What you'll do




Understand the data ecosystem and its role in engineering and machine learning solutions.
Use enterprise knowledge and data to guide our clients toward data-driven decision-making.
Help stakeholders understand data architecture, business intelligence, machine learning, data science, visualisation, and reporting.
Bridge the gap between IT and business and drive organisational change with soft skills.
Drive client growth and transformation through your meaningful contributions.




What you're good at




You know how to work with the Microsoft Azure suite, Databricks, and Microsoft Fabric. Experience with visualisation tools is a big plus.
You know how to work with SQL and/or Python. Experience with writing ETLs and cloud computing is a plus.
You have strong analytical skills, and you love delving into details.
You have experience with business analytics and handling large sets of data.
You have excellent communication skills: you can effortlessly explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
You're intrigued by cutting-edge technologies such as generative AI.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or English. Proficiency in French is a big plus.




This could be you




I love showing our clients a new perspective on their business processes and helping them see how things really work. Add bullet point: make an impact at the client and help them grow/transform.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
What can you expect?

Python Predictions is currently looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer. In this role, you will need to be able to adapt quickly to new technologies, applications and environments. You will operate with our current clients on a medium to long-term basis.

As an ML Engineer, you will help our clients building and serving machine learning models. More specifically, the responsibilities include:

Design and implement solutions to serve machine learning models, from traditional ML to Generative AI.
Train, improve, and deploy ML models.
Write production ready code and serve online, batch, and real time models
Identify, design, and implement process improvements in the machine learning lifecylce: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-design infrastructure for greater scalability, etc
Collaborate with Data Scientists, MLOps Engineers and Data Engineers, to integrate all parts of the solution.
Coach colleagues and clients in your area of expertise







Who are we looking for?

Required

Master or PhD in Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Engineering, or related field.
At least 3 years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, Data Scientist, MLOps Engineer, or in a similar position.
Strong software engineering background
Experience deploying machine learning in production
Experience with experiment tracking, models monitoring, and deployment strategies
Ability to write production ready code in Python.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and understanding of Infrastructure as Code
Knowledge of containers and container orchestration.
Master software engineering best practices and software release cycle.
Solid understanding of Linux and in depth knowledge of at least one cloud provider.
Knowledge of big data technologies such as Apache Spark, Kafka.
Able to coach others and give technical advice and direction.Experience building, scheduling and maintaining ML pipelines
Able to work independently, prioritize multiple stakeholders and tasks, and manage work time effectively
Proficient in English, knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus







What do we have to offer?

Python Predictions is a Brussels-based service provider specialized in data projects with business impact
In January 2020, Python Predictions joined Tobania – a leading Belgian business & technology consulting. And in turn, in March 2023, Tobania joined Sopra Steria – a major Tech player in Europe recognized for its consulting, digital services and software development
Great variation in job content due to missions in different industries, different domains and different environments
In-company training adapted to your personal needs
Continuous learning in monthly team meetings and personal development time
A great team of colleagues with shared values

Discover our Tobania galaxy

Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer - Trustwothy AI
Description:
Step into a critical role at Nemko Digital as our AI (Artificial Intelligence) Engineer specializing in Trustworthy AI. This position is at the forefront of our mission to ensure that AI systems operate with the highest standards of trustworthiness, fairness, and safety.




In this role, you will leverage your AI engineering expertise to define, deploy, operate, and develop our Trustworthy AI Toolbox. Your work will be essential in helping our customers navigate the regulatory and normative landscape of AI, ensuring their systems are fair, transparent, and robust. This is an exceptional opportunity to make a significant impact on a global scale and drive the future of AI technologies.




Key Responsibilities




As the AI (Artificial Intelligence) Engineer for Trustworthy AI at Nemko Digital, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the ethical and technical integrity of AI systems. Your responsibilities will include:




Development and Deployment:

Define, develop, and deploy our Trustworthy AI Toolbox used in delivering technical assurance services.
Implement and operate tools and techniques to ensure AI systems' fairness, transparency, and robustness.




Ethical Frameworks:

Collaborate with Ethical AI experts to develop and maintain ethical guidelines and frameworks.
Ensure compliance with global standards and regulations like the EU AI Act, ISO 42001, and NIST RMF.




Bias Detection and Mitigation:

Utilize techniques and tools to identify and mitigate biases in datasets, algorithms, and models.
Ensure equitable outcomes and provide technical assurance for AI systems.




Technical Audits and Fairness Testing:

Conduct technical audits and fairness tests on AI systems.
Analyze impacts across demographic groups and recommend changes to ensure fairness.




Robustness and Transparency:

Test AI models' robustness against adversarial attacks and unexpected scenarios.
Develop methods to enhance AI systems' transparency and explainability.




Compliance and Standards Adherence:

Ensure AI systems comply with relevant ethical standards, industry regulations, and best practices.
Conduct ethical risk assessments and continuously evaluate AI systems in production.




Stakeholder Collaboration and Training:

Work with customers and internal teams to integrate ethical considerations into the AI development lifecycle.
Develop and deliver training programs on technical assurance and ethical AI best practices.




Key Requirements and More About You




Proven AI Engineering Experience: Demonstrable experience as an AI Engineer with a specific focus on trustworthy AI, emphasizing the development and deployment of ethically sound and reliable AI systems.
AI Monitoring and Testing Expertise: Strong understanding and practical knowledge of AI monitoring and testing methodologies and tools, critical for ensuring the performance and safety of AI systems.
Regulatory Framework Knowledge: Familiarity with relevant regulatory frameworks and standards that govern artificial intelligence, ensuring compliance and ethical integrity of AI deployments.
AI Governance Tools Proficiency: Required proficiency with essential AI Governance tools such as IBM WatsonX and OneTrust AI Governance, or equivalent solutions.
Educational Background: A university degree in Artificial Intelligence, Software Engineering, or a closely related field, providing a strong technical foundation.
Communication and Stakeholder Management: Excellent communication skills and proven abilities in managing stakeholders effectively, essential for collaborative project success.
Language Proficiency: Fluency in English, necessary for clear and effective communication in a global team environment.




More About You




You are an analytical and strategic thinker with a passion for innovation and ethical technology. Your proactive approach and confidence drive you to constantly seek new challenges and opportunities. You thrive in environments where you can leverage your technical skills to solve complex problems and develop innovative solutions. Your ability to think long-term and plan strategically sets you apart, and you are always looking for ways to push boundaries and achieve excellence.




Independence and Proactivity:




You are highly independent and self-motivated, thriving with minimal supervision.
Your proactive nature ensures that you are always ahead, driving innovation and improvement.




Confidence and Decisiveness:




Your confidence and decisiveness enable you to make informed decisions quickly and effectively.
You handle stress well and maintain composure under pressure, ensuring you navigate challenges with ease.




Ethical and Rational Decision-Making:




You prioritize logic and rationality in your decision-making processes.
Your commitment to ethical principles ensures the fairness and transparency of AI systems.




Collaboration and Communication:




You excel at building strong relationships with clients, stakeholders, and team members.
Your ability to communicate complex ideas clearly makes you an effective collaborator and trainer.




Innovation and Improvement:




You constantly seek to improve systems and processes, driving innovation in AI technology.
Your strategic vision and focus on improvement ensure that AI systems are robust, fair, and transparent.




About Nemko Digital




Nemko Digital stands at the forefront of the evolving field of “AI Trust,” addressing both soft and hard assurance elements to meet global regulations and standards such as the EU AI Act, ISO 42001, and NIST RMF. With over 90 years of legacy in ensuring the compliance and trustworthiness of products, systems, and personnel around the world through Nemko Group AS, we are now extending this expertise to the realm of artificial intelligence.




Located in Utrecht, Netherlands, Nemko Digital is dedicated to continuing this tradition by making AI systems reliable, fair, and safe for the digital age. Supported by our parent company headquartered in Oslo and an extensive global network of offices, laboratories, and partners, Nemko Digital leads the charge in pioneering AI assurance and shaping the future of AI innovation.

Title: Applied Machine Learning Research Engineer
Description:
Senior Applied Machine Learning Researcher - Distributed Model Training

Remote




We're hiring for a Machine Learning Researcher for a Series A start-up (over 50 million in funding and backed by top investors). The team are pushing the boundaries of machine learning research in a decentralized and heterogeneous environment. The mission is to train highly distributed models over uniquely decentralized infrastructure, revolutionizing the way neural networks are built and deployed.




Responsibilities:




Train models on decentralized and heterogeneous infrastructure, focusing on high-volume model training.
Serve as a bridge between researchers generating novel ideas and production engineers implementing them.
Manage and maintain experimental frameworks and test benches for ML research.
Provide engineering support, addressing reproducibility and other ML-related issues.
Follow best practices in design, testing, and documentation of code.
Publish research papers for top-tier AI conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, AAAI, IJCAI) and collaborate with academic and research institutions.




Minimum Requirements:




Strong background in applied machine learning with hands-on experience in training models.
Proficient in building and managing distributed systems.
Strong coding skills with a focus on running experiments rather than developing novel concepts.
Comfortable working in a high-autonomy, unpredictable research environment.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.




Preferred Qualifications:




Experience with highly distributed model training.




Please apply for more details, we're looking forward to hearing from you

Show more

Please apply for more details, we're looking forward to hearing from you

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
What can you expect?

Python Predictions is currently looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer. In this role, you will need to be able to adapt quickly to new technologies, applications and environments. You will operate with our current clients on a medium to long-term basis.

As an ML Engineer, you will help our clients building and serving machine learning models. More specifically, the responsibilities include:

Design and implement solutions to serve machine learning models, from traditional ML to Generative AI.
Train, improve, and deploy ML models.
Write production ready code and serve online, batch, and real time models
Identify, design, and implement process improvements in the machine learning lifecylce: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-design infrastructure for greater scalability, etc
Collaborate with Data Scientists, MLOps Engineers and Data Engineers, to integrate all parts of the solution.
Coach colleagues and clients in your area of expertise







Who are we looking for?

Required

Master or PhD in Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Engineering, or related field.
At least 3 years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, Data Scientist, MLOps Engineer, or in a similar position.
Strong software engineering background
Experience deploying machine learning in production
Experience with experiment tracking, models monitoring, and deployment strategies
Ability to write production ready code in Python.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and understanding of Infrastructure as Code
Knowledge of containers and container orchestration.
Master software engineering best practices and software release cycle.
Solid understanding of Linux and in depth knowledge of at least one cloud provider.
Knowledge of big data technologies such as Apache Spark, Kafka.
Able to coach others and give technical advice and direction.Experience building, scheduling and maintaining ML pipelines
Able to work independently, prioritize multiple stakeholders and tasks, and manage work time effectively
Proficient in English, knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus







What do we have to offer?

Python Predictions is a Brussels-based service provider specialized in data projects with business impact
In January 2020, Python Predictions joined Tobania – a leading Belgian business & technology consulting. And in turn, in March 2023, Tobania joined Sopra Steria – a major Tech player in Europe recognized for its consulting, digital services and software development
Great variation in job content due to missions in different industries, different domains and different environments
In-company training adapted to your personal needs
Continuous learning in monthly team meetings and personal development time
A great team of colleagues with shared values

Discover our Tobania galaxy

Title: Python Developer
Description:
A prominent organization at the forefront of a critical industry in Europe, contributing to the transition towards a sustainable future. This company is essential in ensuring the reliability and sustainability of key infrastructure across multiple regions. As Python Developer you will join a team of professionals dedicated to developing systems that support economic growth and reduce environmental impact.




Job Description




As a Python Developer, you will contribute to the development of a framework for building Python applications.




Your key responsibilities include:

Enhancing features and packages within the framework
Testing the framework on various IT platforms
Collaborating with a cross-functional team to establish general standards
Developing features such as security, messaging, and database communication
Utilizing development tools like Git and Azure DevOps
Setting up and expanding automated code tests
Documenting and reporting on your work




Profile




5+ years of experience in Python development
Strong knowledge of Python with a focus on FastAPI
Good command of the English language
Solid understanding of software design patterns, continuous integration, and security
Ability to quickly adapt to existing codebases
Proactive and collaborative approach with a “getting things done” mentality
Capable of structuring and executing tasks independently




Offer




An exciting project with a leading organization in a critical industry
The opportunity to contribute to innovative technologies driving sustainability
A strong emphasis on well-being within a positive work culture
Collaboration in a diverse and inclusive team of passionate professionals
A flexible working environment with a balance of office and remote work




You will be part of a forward-thinking team that values innovation and collaboration.




Interested?

Send us your resume at anne@bimona.be

Title: MLops Engineer (Data Science)
Description:
We are looking for an engineering profile with a data science background and a focus on MLops and Azure cloud environment to join our team.

We're building our cloud environment from the ground up and need new talent to join our team and help us scale to 100+ projects. Azure machine learning is a central component in the cloud architecture. Additionally, we want to improve our on-premises environment, which won’t disappear anytime soon, and blend some azure components in it.

Next to the MLops role, you'll have the opportunity to work on data science use cases, this entails you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right machine learning solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production.

If you're someone who loves to think about architecture, set it up, and then figure out how to break it, we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities


Automating everything related to the ML lifecycle to ensure efficiency and scalability.
Using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) practices, such as Bicep, to manage and provision resources through code.
Implementing best practices for continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD) pipelines, ensuring that ML models are reliably deployed to production environments.
Collaborate with data scientists to deploy, monitor, and troubleshoot machine learning models and applications using Azure Machine Learning, Azure devops and Azure AI Services.
Challenge our existing security and reinforce our defenses.



Profile


Master's degree in computer science, data science, engineering, or related field.
At least 2 years of experience in data engineering, data science, or related roles.
Proficient in Python.
Experience with Azure cloud services and tools, notably azure machine learning and azure devops.
Experience with mlops concepts and frameworks.
Knowledge on containerized deployment of ML products – e.g. docker, podman, Kubernetes.
Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.
Fluent in English is a must. Dutch and/or French is considered as a plus.



Show more

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Trilogy are partnered with a leading utilities customer who are looking to add a strong 'Python Airflow' engineer to their IT department. This will be a long term contractual engagement, with two days per week required onsite.




The client is looking for someone with the following:




Python
Airflow
Docker




Ideally the individual will be available on short term notice, maximum we can wait for the right profiles is a 4 week notice period.




If interested, please apply for immediate consideration.

Title: Junior Engineer
Description:
Sia Partners is a specialist Management Consulting firm created in 1999 and has grown into a global firm with approximately 2800 employees and annual revenue exceeding $400m. Our culture is strongly orientated towards high-quality expertise and delivering excellent results and outcomes for our clients, which include a wide range of multinational companies. Our global presence and our expertise in more than 40 sectors and services allows us to accompany clients worldwide. Using innovative technologies such as our own in-house apps, social networks, and digital tools, we provide a truly integrated global service.

Through Consulting for Good, we put our expertise at the service of our clients' climate objectives and make sustainable development a performance lever for our clients. Our portfolio of offerings is cross-sectors and 17 % of our revenue is generated from engagements with a CSR focus.



Job Description



Sia Partners is looking for bright and dynamic junior enigneer committed to building relationships and delivering results. We are interested in people with good track records during their education and, preferably, with a first successful and relevant job experience. We believe in people we hire, so we encourage you to take up responsibility as fast as possible. Your personal growth is our goal.

As an engineer consultant, you will be involved in transformation projects at our clients. You will execute project assignments, including intelligent data structuring, data analysis, benchmarks, interviews, workshop animation, process mapping, functional specifications, etc. As fast as possible, you will take up team support roles. You will get the opportunity to contribute actively to our knowledge creation and exchange (workshops, publications, seminars,…) within the business units of the different industries we serve.

Equipped with the entrepreneurial fibre, you are ready to collaborate with us in a fast growing company.



Qualifications


University Master Civil Engineering or Business Engineering
0 to 3 years’ experience as a consultant
Outstanding collaborative team player and good communication skills
Strong interest in Energy
Analytical mind, exploring options and able to synthesize into conclusions
Autonomous, dynamic, result oriented, rigorous and committed
Languages: Trilingual French, Dutch and English.
Prepared to participate in temporary assignments abroad (e.g. France, The Netherlands)


Additional Information



We are unable to provide a work permit for this position

Sia Partners is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Sia Partners is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Title: AI & Data Analytics Engineer
Description:
Company Description

We are Netcompany-Intrasoft, a member of Netcompany Group A/S, and a leading European IT Solutions and Services company with strong international presence and expertise, dedicated to responsible digitalisation. We offer innovative and added-value solutions of the highest quality to a wide range of public and private organizations, while being a key-player in the EU Institutions for the past 30 years. We hold an outstanding record of 500+ organizations in 70+ countries, that have chosen our solutions and services, to fulfil their business needs. Our team of 3500+ professionals is our driving force and our most valuable asset.

For more information regarding our company, as current projects, job openings around Europe and life at Netcompany-Intrasoft, please visit our website: www.netcompany.com.

Job Description

Are you ready to discover the role of a AI & Data Analytics Engineer in Netcompany-Intrasoft?

Joining us as a AI & Data Analytics Engineer, you will have the opportunity to be a part of our highly skilled agile consultants teams working within large-scale transformation projects, that impact the life of millions of EU citizens.

As a AI & Data Analytics Engineer You Will


Gathering and analysis of the business requirements.
SWOT Analysis and return of investment definition.
Technical analysis and specifications of AI and DA solutions.
Exploratory data analysis to identify, analyse, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets for diagnosis and prediction.
Design, modelling, development, management and review of end-to-end DA and AI products, prototypes and proof of concept based on on-prem and cloud data platforms. Including: data preparation and collection, feature engineering, model selection and training, visualisation, deployment, monitoring and maintenance.
Set-up of MLOps including automatic testing and quality assurance.
Definition and drafting of training and support procedures.
Maintenance of DA and AI products, including troubleshooting, bug fixing, performance analysis, technical migrations, …
Architecture, design, deployment, and management of Data Platforms building blocks would be an asset.
Integration and reusability of COTS, SaaS, PaaS and SaaS.
Conception and implementation of data protection measures, data security measures and disclosure control.
Definition of test strategies, design, and testing.
Definition of best practices and standards.
Technology watch, technology evaluation and contribution to platform definition and strategy documents.


Qualifications

What would make you a fit for the role:


A Master's degree and 8+ years of experience
Ability to effectively communicate with business stakeholders and explain complex technical elements in a simple way.
Excellent analytical thinking, by using logic and reasoning to identify patterns and gaps while analysing and exploring data.
In depth knowledge of Statistical analysis and data-driven decision-making.
Extensive experience of Data Science and AI techniques, especially in prediction, machine learning and Generative AI.
In depth knowledge of programming languages for data analytics and artificial intelligence (eg: python, R, …) and frameworks (eg: .Net AI and SpringAI)
Experience in machine learning algorithms (eg: ANN, random forest, …) and deep learning frameworks
Experience developing with reusable AI models (eg: huggingface), Generative AI APIs (eg: openai),
Extensive experience in industrialization of DA and AI solutions
In depth knowledge of MLOps tools, testing and quality assurance.
Knowledge of visualisation tools (eg: PowerBI)
Knowledge of SQL (eg: Oracle, SQL Server,…)
Knowledge of orchestration (eg: Airflow) and ETL tools (eg: DBT, SSIS, …)
Knowledge of No-SQL database (eg: MongoDB, Neo4j, …)
Knowledge of search engines (eg: ElasticSearch, SOLR, …)
Experience in setting up a Centre of Competence to provide advice, support and training for Data Analytics and AI related activities.
Validation of technological orientations.
Validation of business cases and/or maturity assessment studies.
Knowledge of data modelling for data lakes and data warehouses.
Technical guidance including solution finding for highly complicated issues.
Experience in real time reporting would be an asset.
Experience in linked open data and semantic technologies, ontologies, metadata standards, reference databases, multilingual thesauri and taxonomies would be an asset.
Experience in cloud environments and containerisation


Additional Information

Being a part of the Netcompany-Ιntrasoft team, you will be provided with:


The opportunity to work in a modern environment.
A competitive compensation & benefits package.
Hospitalization plan.
Hybrid working model.
Meal and commuting allowance.
Well-being activities (on premises).
Continuous learning opportunities using the most modern methods (unlimited access to Udemy for Business, ad-hoc trainings).
A personalized development plan for targeted career growth.


If you are looking forward to be part of a diverse environment, and have the opportunity to work alongside well-experienced professionals, on challenging, large-scale projects that directly impact millions of citizens around the globe, then this is the place to be!


Please submit your CV in English


All applications will be treated as strictly confidential.

Our culture

Our people are the most important element of our success. Our work life is well defined by our set of fundamental Values: https://bit.ly/3SSbBzU

#BePartOfSomethingGreat!


Please submit your CV in English


All applications will be treated as strictly confidential.

Should you be invited for an interview and be considered suitable candidates for the EU project at the first stage, we inform you that your CV may be forwarded to the relevant European Organization or third companies - consortium members participating in the specific EU project together with NETCOMPANY INTRASOFT for evaluation.

We ensure equal opportunities, treatment, and consideration to all candidates. Discrimination based on sex, racial or ethnic origin, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other factor protected by applicable laws and regulations is prohibited. As part of the Netcompany-Intrasoft culture, we respect human rights and focus on creating a positive workplace, where all employees are valued, and where diversity and inclusion are a vital part of our our everyday working experience.

Company Description

We are Netcompany-Intrasoft, a member of Netcompany Group A/S, and a leading European IT Solutions and Services company with strong international presence and expertise, dedicated to responsible digitalisation. We offer innovative and added-value solutions of the highest quality to a wide range of public and private organizations, while being a key-player in the EU Institutions for the past 30 years. We hold an outstanding record of 500+ organizations in 70+ countries, that have chosen our solutions and services, to fulfil their business needs. Our team of 3500+ professionals is our driving force and our most valuable asset.

For more information regarding our company, as current projects, job openings around Europe and life at Netcompany-Intrasoft, please visit our website: www.netcompany.com.

Job Description

Are you ready to discover the role of a AI & Data Analytics Engineer in Netcompany-Intrasoft?

Joining us as a AI & Data Analytics Engineer, you will have the opportunity to be a part of our highly skilled agile consultants teams working within large-scale transformation projects, that impact the life of millions of EU citizens.

As a AI & Data Analytics Engineer You Will

  • Gathering and analysis of the business requirements.

Including: data preparation and collection, feature engineering, model selection and training, visualisation, deployment, monitoring and maintenance.
  • Set-up of MLOps including automatic testing and quality assurance.
  • Definition and drafting of training and support procedures.

Title: AI Engineer - Energy and Utilities
Description:
Position Description

As an AI engineer, you will join our international emerging technology practice. You will be working in an agile team at one of our customers where you will take the responsibility of further implementation and expansion of their generative AI platform. You will set-up data connections with other data sources like Salesforce and ServiceNow. If you are passionate about information technology and are excited about continuous learning opportunities we want to hear from you.

Your role in our team


Your will create AI orchestrator/pipelines using Microsoft nuget packages
You will deploy AI models with monitoring capabilities to ensure reliability and accuracy using MLOps principles.
Finetuning of GPT3.5 and GPT4.0 models: focus of AI model on specific domains of expertise.
You will handle the Integration of the AI solution within the existing application landscape.
You will work as part of a team in close collaboration with architects and data engineers to Build complete end-to-end AI solutions.


How You Strengthen Our Team


You have at least 3 years of experience in Python and/or .NET development
You have already a first professional experience
Familiar with AI solutions on the Azure ecosystem (cognitive search, OpenAI)
Previous experience with embedding datasets in Cognitive Services for Semantic search.
Experience in working with Vector databases
Knowledge of the Langchain framework
You have mathematical mindset and like solving complex problems.
Native NL or FR and a very good lEN level
Education and Certification
Bachelor or master degree in computer science, or equivalent


A pre-employment screening is part of the application process

Why CGI?

CGI is one of the world's largest IT consultancy companies. Our people keep Belgium running. Government institutions, banks, infrastructure organisations, energy , utilities, manufacturing and lifesciences companies are CGI's clients. We work on interesting projects that touch the everyday lives of millions of people. We have a regional presence, reinforced with global domain expertise, our ecosystem and colleagues spread across the globe.

We are proud of the impactful projects we make a success together with our colleagues.

At CGI, we value diversity and inclusion as it not only promotes collaboration, but also often leads to better results. We look forward to your contribution to our team!

Working in small self-managing teams consisting of experts in your field.


Directing your own career with the space to keep developing yourself.
You work with the latest technologies.
An excellent salary and attractive fringe benefits
An immediate permanent contract
And the opportunity to become a CGI shareholder


Join our team of experts and apply now!

Questions about the position? Ask them to Bart Jansen, Director Energy sector , via bart.jansen@cgi.com.

For more information about the application procedure, please contact recruiter Fabienne Philips fabienne.philips@cgi.com

We do not collaborate with external recruitment agencies. Therefore, unsolicited acquisition is not appreciated.

Your future duties and responsibilities

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

Title: Expert Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
🤖 The Job

Dataroots specialises in crafting robust AI solutions and platforms across diverse sectors, with a keen focus on DataOps and MLOps. As an Expert Machine Learning Engineer, you'll be an integral part of our dedicated in-house team of AI specialists. Your role entails constructing and refining machine learning models that culminate in resilient, production-ready solutions aimed at optimising company processes.

You possess an unwavering passion for data, adept at unraveling its intricacies to unveil its hidden insights. With extensive experience in handling big data, you excel in developing and implementing a wide spectrum of statistical and machine learning models. Your responsibility extends to meticulously overseeing the performance of your models' output, constantly striving to experiment with novel approaches to deliver best-in-class solutions to clients. Collaboration with our data engineers and cloud architects across projects spanning various sectors is paramount, always adhering to a quality-centric, end-to-end approach. The ultimate outcome? Empowering our clients with a dependable foundation for data-driven decision-making




As a senior member, you'll play a pivotal role in fostering knowledge-sharing initiatives within the team. Through a plethora of avenues, you'll actively contribute to disseminating expertise while staying abreast of the latest advancements in the field.




🎉 What you can expect at Dataroots

Dataroots was founded in 2016 and, since its beginnings, has focused on helping its customers achieve excellence in their data-driven operations. The only way to do this sustainably is by investing in team well-being, diversity, knowledge sharing and customer experience. This quality-first focus has allowed sustained and healthy growth over the years. Join a team where you can have an impact on our growth story. Read up more on our DNA over at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].




💪 The Skills

You bring these qualities and experiences to the job:

Mastery in Machine Learning, backed by a Master's or Doctorate in a quantitative field.
A profound understanding and strong opinions on software design principles.
Extensive industry experience, with a minimum of 4+ years in machine learning and big data.
Strong theoretical grounding and practical expertise in general machine learning and deep learning.
Excellency in both Python & SQL is a must, with additional familiarity in Scala/R.
Demonstrated proficiency in deploying ML models and expertise in MLOps.
Comprehensive understanding of cloud engineering.
Familiarity with GenAI is a big plus.
Enthusiasm for working with substantial datasets.
Pragmatic problem-solving approach.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of translating complex solutions into lucid explanations.
Thorough comprehension of the (big) data ecosystem.
Experience in the consultancy sector is a big plus.
Fluency in English. Speaking Dutch or French fluently is a big plus.
You have EU citizenship or a permanent VISA.




💰 The Offer

An attractive salary package with extralegal benefits such as a company car & fuel card or mobility budget, hospitalisation insurance, group insurance, and a high-end laptop and a smartphone.
A personal & team training budget to further your professional career.
Your innovation budget to work on cool, educational, challenging and open-source projects within your guild.
Team Buildings, team gatherings to let off steam and be part of our sports initiatives.




🇧🇪 Our main offices are in Leuven, Ghent and Utrecht 🇳🇱, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These locations are always available for brainstorming sessions or team events. As a Dataroots consultant, much work can be performed remotely, but you will most likely also visit our clients on-site.




Ready for a new chapter as an Expert Machine Learning Engineer at Dataroots? Super! Apply now! 🎉

Title: Engineer
Description:
Numéro de l'Emploi 24143304

Catégorie d'Emploi Engineering & Facilities

Lieu Renaissance Brussels Hotel, Rue du Parnasse 19, Brussels, Brussel, Belgium AFFICHER SUR LA CARTE

Horaire Full-Time

Situé à distance ? N

Mutation? N

Type de Poste Non-Management

Répondre et traiter les demandes de réparation des clients. Communiquer avec les clients afin de résoudre les problèmes de maintenance. Effectuer l’entretien préventif des outils et de l’équipement de la cuisine et de la chambre des appareils mécaniques, y compris le nettoyage et la lubrification. Inspecter visuellement les outils, l’équipement ou les machines. Transporter de l’équipement (p. ex., outils, radio). Identifier, localiser et actionner toutes les vannes d’arrêt de l’équipement et toutes les manettes de fermeture des services publics pour les bâtiments. Maintenir les stocks requis pour l’entretien et commander les pièces et les fournitures nécessaires. Communiquer les activités et les problèmes qui se produisent chaque jour aux autres équipes à l’aide des normes et des programmes de communication approuvés. Avoir des connaissances de base ou la capacité d’acquérir ces connaissances dans les catégories suivantes : climatisation et réfrigération, électricité, mécanique, plomberie, systèmes et contrôles pneumatiques et électroniques, menuiserie et finition, matériel de cuisine, véhicules, conservation de l’énergie et en bâtiment. Effectuer toute la préparation de surfaces, la peinture, les réparations mineures aux plaques de plâtre et aux boiseries, le remplacement des ampoules et des filtres de climatiseur, et le nettoyage complet et minutieux des zones de peinture ou de réparation. Tester, dépanner et effectuer les réparations de base sur tous les types d’équipement, de plomberie (p. ex., déboucher les toilettes et les drains), les composants électriques, y compris les lampes, les articles cosmétiques, les rallonges électriques, les aspirateurs, les appareils Internet, remplacer les interrupteurs et les prises électriques, et autres articles des chambres de clients. Programmer les téléviseurs et effectuer des tâches d’entretien général et d’inventaire ayant trait à l’ingénierie. Utiliser le système de cadenassage avant d’effectuer des travaux d’entretien. Effectuer les réparations à l’aménagement paysager intérieur et extérieur ainsi que les gicleurs de l’aménagement paysager extérieur. Avoir des compétences informatiques de base, y compris la saisie des horaires des appareils de traitement d’air et effectuer les changements de température.

Suivre toutes les politiques et procédures de l’entreprise; signaler les problèmes d’entretien, conditions de travail dangereuses, accidents et les blessures; réussir la formation et les certifications de sécurité; et stocker les matériaux inflammables selon les consignes de sécurité. S’assurer de porter un uniforme de travail propre et complet; avoir une apparence soignée et professionnelle en tout temps sur les lieux de travail; respecter la confidentialité dans la diffusion d’informations propres à la bannière et/ou à l’hôtel et protéger tous les biens de la compagnie. Accueillir et saluer tous les clients selon les normes de l’entreprise; anticiper et traiter les besoins de service des clients; aider les personnes handicapées et remercier les clients en leur témoignant une véritable reconnaissance. Respecter des exigences et des standards de qualité. Développer des relations professionnelles positives et constructives avec vos pairs; s’unir et s’entraider afin d’atteindre les buts communs; écouter et répondre de façon appropriée aux problèmes des autres employés. Utiliser un langage clair et courtois lors de toute communication. Déplacer, soulever, porter, pousser, tirer et placer des objets pesant moins de 50 livres (22,7 kg) sans assistance et des objets pesant plus avec assistance. Monter et descendre les escaliers, les rampes de service et les échelles. Atteindre les objets au-dessus de la tête et au-dessous des genoux, y compris se plier, faire des rotations du corps, tirer et se baisser. Entrer et trouver de l’information en lien avec le travail en utilisant des ordinateurs. S’acquitter d’autres tâches d’emploi raisonnables lorsqu’elles sont demandées.

Qualifications Recommandées

Niveau d’études: Diplôme d’études secondaires ou équivalence de niveau secondaire et expérience professionnelle ou technique recommandés.

Expérience de travail connexe: Expérience en entretien général, préparation et peinture de surfaces intérieures et extérieures.

Une expérience en maintenance/ingénierie hôtelière est un atout.

Expérience de supervision: Aucune expérience de supervision.

Qualifications Requises

Permis ou certification: Permis de conduire valide

Marriott International souscrit au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi. Nous sommes attachés à recruter un effectif diversifié et à soutenir une culture inclusive qui donne la priorité aux individus. Nous nous engageons à respecter des principes de non-discrimination envers tous les individus protégés, par exemple les personnes handicapées et les anciens combattants, et envers toute autre base couverte par la législation applicable.

Chez Renaissance Hotels, il nous tient à cœur d'aider notre clientèle à ressentir pleinement l'ADN des lieux qu'elle visite. Elle vient pour découvrir l'inattendu, pour se plonger dans une autre culture ou simplement pour profiter au maximum d'une soirée sans contrainte. Pour elle, le voyage d'affaires est une aventure parce qu'elle considèrent tous les voyages comme une aventure. Là où d'autres se contentent de l'ordinaire, notre clientèle voit une chance de repartir avec de beaux souvenirs à la Et nous aussi. Nous recherchons de véritables explorateurs et exploratrices pour rejoindre notre équipe et transmettre à notre clientèle l'esprit des environs de nos hôtels. Si vous vous reconnaissez dans ce profil, nous vous invitons à consulter les offres d'emploi de Renaissance Hotels. En intégrant l'équipe Renaissance Hotels, vous rejoignez également le portefeuille d'établissements de Marriott International. Choisissez une entreprise qui vous donne la possibilité de donner le meilleur de vous-même, de donner un sens à votre vie professionnelle, de faire partie d'une incroyable équipe internationale et de devenir la meilleure version de vous-même.
Show more
HTML:
Numéro de l'Emploi 24143304

Catégorie d'Emploi Engineering & Facilities

Lieu Renaissance Brussels Hotel, Rue du Parnasse 19, Brussels, Brussel, Belgium AFFICHER SUR LA CARTE

Horaire Full-Time

Situé à distance ? N

Mutation? N

Type de Poste Non-Management

Répondre et traiter les demandes de réparation des clients. Communiquer avec les clients afin de résoudre les problèmes de maintenance. Effectuer l’entretien préventif des outils et de l’équipement de la cuisine et de la chambre des appareils mécaniques, y compris le nettoyage et la lubrification. Inspecter visuellement les outils, l’équipement ou les machines. Transporter de l’équipement (p. ex., outils, radio). Identifier, localiser et actionner toutes les vannes d’arrêt de l’équipement et toutes les manettes de fermeture des services publics pour les bâtiments. Maintenir les stocks requis pour l’entretien et commander les pièces et les fournitures nécessaires. Communiquer les activités et les problèmes qui se produisent chaque jour aux autres équipes à l’aide des normes et des programmes de communication approuvés. Avoir des connaissances de base ou la capacité d’acquérir ces connaissances dans les catégories suivantes : climatisation et réfrigération, électricité, mécanique, plomberie, systèmes et contrôles pneumatiques et électroniques, menuiserie et finition, matériel de cuisine, véhicules, conservation de l’énergie et en bâtiment. Effectuer toute la préparation de surfaces, la peinture, les réparations mineures aux plaques de plâtre et aux boiseries, le remplacement des ampoules et des filtres de climatiseur, et le nettoyage complet et minutieux des zones de peinture ou de réparation. Tester, dépanner et effectuer les réparations de base sur tous les types d’équipement, de plomberie (p. ex., déboucher les toilettes et les drains), les composants électriques, y compris les lampes, les articles cosmétiques, les rallonges électriques, les aspirateurs, les appareils Internet, remplacer les interrupteurs et les prises électriques, et autres articles des chambres de clients. Programmer les téléviseurs et effectuer des tâches d’entretien général et d’inventaire ayant trait à l’ingénierie. Utiliser le système de cadenassage avant d’effectuer des travaux d’entretien. Effectuer les réparations à l’aménagement paysager intérieur et extérieur ainsi que les gicleurs de l’aménagement paysager extérieur. Avoir des compétences informatiques de base, y compris la saisie des horaires des appareils de traitement d’air et effectuer les changements de température.

Suivre toutes les politiques et procédures de l’entreprise; signaler les problèmes d’entretien, conditions de travail dangereuses, accidents et les blessures; réussir la formation et les certifications de sécurité; et stocker les matériaux inflammables selon les consignes de sécurité. S’assurer de porter un uniforme de travail propre et complet; avoir une apparence soignée et professionnelle en tout temps sur les lieux de travail; respecter la confidentialité dans la diffusion d’informations propres à la bannière et/ou à l’hôtel et protéger tous les biens de la compagnie. Accueillir et saluer tous les clients selon les normes de l’entreprise; anticiper et traiter les besoins de service des clients; aider les personnes handicapées et remercier les clients en leur témoignant une véritable reconnaissance. Respecter des exigences et des standards de qualité. Développer des relations professionnelles positives et constructives avec vos pairs; s’unir et s’entraider afin d’atteindre les buts communs; écouter et répondre de façon appropriée aux problèmes des autres employés. Utiliser un langage clair et courtois lors de toute communication. Déplacer, soulever, porter, pousser, tirer et placer des objets pesant moins de 50 livres (22,7 kg) sans assistance et des objets pesant plus avec assistance. Monter et descendre les escaliers, les rampes de service et les échelles. Atteindre les objets au-dessus de la tête et au-dessous des genoux, y compris se plier, faire des rotations du corps, tirer et se baisser. Entrer et trouver de l’information en lien avec le travail en utilisant des ordinateurs. S’acquitter d’autres tâches d’emploi raisonnables lorsqu’elles sont demandées.

Qualifications Recommandées

Niveau d’études: Diplôme d’études secondaires ou équivalence de niveau secondaire et expérience professionnelle ou technique recommandés.

Expérience de travail connexe: Expérience en entretien général, préparation et peinture de surfaces intérieures et extérieures.

Une expérience en maintenance/ingénierie hôtelière est un atout.

Expérience de supervision: Aucune expérience de supervision.

Qualifications Requises

Title: Project Engineer: AI Perception & Robotics Navigation
Description:
The Robotics Software and Intelligence (RSI) Division is responsible for the study, design, prototyping and development of state-of-the-art robotics products for our customers.




Position




The role primarily involves leading the technical design and development of Artificial Intelligence (AI) based perception and robot navigation software. Additionally, the successful candidate will manage projects, engage with customers, and provide technical support for the Business Development Team.




Key responsibilities include the development and deployment of advanced perception, localization, and navigation systems for ground, aerial, and marine robots. This position focuses on applications across terrestrial, space, maritime, and defence domains, contributing to the advancement of autonomous systems technology.




The successful candidate will be part of the Robotics, Software & Intelligence (RSI) Team.

The candidate will mainly report to the RSI Team Lead.




Location: Sint-Stevens-Woluwe (Brussels Area)
Start date: As of November 2024




Tasks and Responsibilities




Lead technical activities in the Data Fusion Team
Support to Project Management and Business Development Teams
Analyse the projects requirements from use cases
Identify and analyse solutions from the State-of-the-Art in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Deep Learning
Design, develop, test and tune software applied to perception, mapping, localisation, navigation and/or data fusion in general
Participate to the end-to-end implementation, testing, integration and optimisation of target robot architecture
Generate the technical documentation required all along the process.




Skills and Experience




A Masters or PhD in AI, Robotics, Computer Vision, Computer Science or relevant field
3-5 years of demonstrable applied research or industrial experience in AI, perception and navigation for robots
2-3 years of demonstrable project management skills
Very strong programming skills (C++, Python) on Linux environment and Git tools




Background in:

Computer vision, state estimation, sensor data fusion, mapping, path planning and trajectory control
AI and specifically Machine Learning - Deep Learning applied to perception




Experience with/in:

DL frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras)
Robotics Software development in ROS/ROS2




Strength to cope with schedules and deadlines
Fast learner and ability to adopt new technologies
Ability to work independently with a good sense of responsibility and results driven
Available to be involved and support off-site activities in robotics demonstrations
Excellent English, both spoken and written with good skills in technical documentation delivery.




Considered as Assets




Agile methodology such as Scrum using tools such as JIRA




Experience with:

Desiginig software and system architecture
Generating relevant data sets
Building and maintaining CI pipelines using gitlab




Familiarity with and knowledge of:

Integrating with robots
Simulators or simulation frameworks (IssacSim, Gazebo..)
RTOS and/or GPU level programming
Multi-robot cooperative navigation
Writing proposals for EC/ESA or commercial contracts




Our Offer




Working within an exceptional sector with Staff located in Belgium, Germany and the Netherlands
A professional and modern working environment with motivated Administrative Staff, Engineers, Astronaut Training Instructors and Scientists coming from all different horizons and countries with a common passion for space and their own expertise
A full-time position with an indefinite contract of employment
A competitive remuneration package and good working conditions
Working from home in part can be a possibility
An individualised training and development programmes.







About Us




Space Applications Services is a Company at the forefront of space technology development and the provision of services for human spaceflight, exploration and earth observation missions. Headquartered in Belgium (Brussels Area), with a research office in the Netherlands and a subsidiary in the USA, the Company provides solutions for both commercial and institutional customers. We work with Clients such as the European Space Agency, the European Commission, governmental and national space agencies as well as the major space industries.

The Company develops payloads, avionics, robotics technology and products, and provides complete mission operations control centre solutions to EN9100 standards.

The Company also provides engineering, science and training services, including astronaut training.

From our headquarters, we are in daily contact with the International Space Station (ISS) ensuring our Customers’ research is successful.




How To Apply




Upload your CV, Motivation Letter and a Reference Letter, to the attention of Mr Shashank Govindaraj.




The candidate shall be eligible to work in the European Union for a couple of years.

Title: Space Data Software Engineer
Description:
Are you looking for a new opportunity to take your career to a higher orbit? To join an international group with a successful track record in Space Engineering? A job adapted to your career ambitions and in which you could have an impact for the years to come?

We are looking for a Space Data Software Engineer to join our software development team located in Diegem, Belgium.




In this role, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the development of an operational data processing, storage and dissemination system for scientific data obtained from satellites. The system will leverage cloud technologies to ensure scalability as the demand for its services increases.




Tasks and activities




The scope of work will include:

Involvement in the design and development of data processing and analysis software systems for both current and future satellite missions for our customers in the European space industry:
Implementing and testing software for space projects;
Supporting the analysis of user requirements and contributing to the design and modelling of the system;
Developing and deploying cloud-based systems;
Implementing and testing data processing and distribution systems for space instrument data.
Engaging in challenging projects as one of the key software engineers, developing systems for space applications in areas such as ground segment data processing, operations preparation and support, and automated monitoring and control of spacecraft.




Skills and experience




The following skills and experience are mandatory:

University Degree or equivalent in software engineering or a relevant field.
At least 3 years of proven experience in software engineering.
Knowledge of object-oriented and service-oriented design techniques.
Hands-on experience in the following:
Java
Database technologies, SQL
Web technologies (HTTP, Apache, tomcat, Web services, etc.)
REST Interfaces Implementation Technologies
User interface design (React)
Continuous Integration using Maven, Jenkins, Nexus and GIT
Linux
Knowledge of technical document writing – notably, user requirements, design documentation, and test documentation.
Desire to work both autonomously and as part of a team, in an international multicultural environment.
Solution-oriented mindset, with a customer-focused communication skill.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.

The following skills and experience would be highly desirable:

Competence with user interface design (RCP, Angular, React, Vue).
Proficiency in Docker and/or Kubernetes configuration and deployment.
Experience with Agile software development and continuous integration practices.




Why should you apply?




You will have the opportunity to work within leading space organisations across Europe.
We encourage everyone to think outside the box and to push the boundaries of traditional knowledge. This role is an opportunity to join a forward-thinking company and allows for a deeper understanding of the industry.
To be part of a company that values integrity, inspiration, care and collaboration.
Benefits include competitive remuneration packages; unique career opportunities, including working in other countries; access to training and development programmes; flexible relocation support.




We welcome applications from people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, all genders, LGBTQ+ individuals and ex-service personnel.

Title: Java Full Stack Developer
Description:
🌐 APSIDE BELGIUM - A Leader in IT Consulting: Established in 2011, APSIDE BELGIUM has made its mark in IT consulting, specializing in Cloud services, Cybersecurity, and Data Solutions. Our dynamic and resilient team offers customized and innovative services.




🚀 Join Our Team in Brussels: We are eagerly seeking a Java Full Stack Developer (5 to 10 years of experience) who is innovative and proactive. This role is a unique opportunity to be part of our forward-thinking team, working on exciting and cutting-edge technology projects.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop Full Stack applications using Java, Spring Boot, and modern front-end technologies like Angular or React.
Ensure the quality and performance of applications through continuous testing and optimization.
Collaboratively work with team members to design and deploy captivating new features.
Maintain and enhance existing applications to ensure their efficiency and modernity.




Technical Prerequisites:

Strong experience in Java, Spring Boot, and front-end frameworks like Angular or React.
Good understanding of SQL and NoSQL databases.
Experience in developing responsive and high-performance web applications.
Knowledge of design principles and architectural patterns.




Personal Skills:

Excellent communication skills in French and English; Dutch knowledge is a plus.
Ability to work independently, effectively managing time and priorities.
Analytical and problem-solving approach with attention to detail.
Strong willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies and working methods.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent experience.
Strong experience as a Java Full Stack Developer.
A portfolio demonstrating relevant projects would be an advantage.




📢 "Apply now for an innovative career at APSIDE BELGIUM, where your Java Full Stack Developer skills will advance tomorrow's technology!"

Title: Senior Consultant in Data science
Description:
Sia Partners is a specialist Management Consulting firm created in 1999 and has grown into a global firm with approximately 2800 employees and annual revenue exceeding $400m. Our culture is strongly orientated towards high-quality expertise and delivering excellent results and outcomes for our clients, which include a wide range of multinational companies. Our global presence and our expertise in more than 40 sectors and services allows us to accompany clients worldwide. Using innovative technologies such as our own in-house apps, social networks, and digital tools, we provide a truly integrated global service.

Through Consulting for Good, we put our expertise at the service of our clients' climate objectives and make sustainable development a performance lever for our clients. Our portfolio of offerings is cross-sectors and 17 % of our revenue is generated from engagements with a CSR focus.




Job Description



As a Senior consultant in Data Science, you will be involved in transformation projects at our clients. You will execute project assignments in modelling and digital transformation (business/IT analysis and partial coding) environments with a good deal of business perspectives:

Machine learning, AI and statistics: developing predictive models of decision making (supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, econometrics, forecasting, quantitative diagnosis,...)
Operational research : assistance in the design and implementation of constraint optimization solutions and simulation models
Big Data : Algorithmic knowledge for large and unstructured data processing

You will get the opportunity to actively contribute to Sia Partners’ internal activities:

Development and reinforcement of our offer, by understanding and interpreting data science innovation and challenges
Business development, by contributing to need definition and participating in our commercial initiatives

As fast as possible, you will take up team leadership roles and connect with colleagues of all levels.

Equipped with the entrepreneurial fibre, you are ready to cooperate in a fast growing company.

In return, you can expect:

An international company that gives importance to diversity, inclusion, employee well-being and corporate social responsibilities actions.
A great working atmosphere with friendly and professional colleagues where innovation and entrepreneurship are encouraged
A personal development plan with a regular follow-up as well training opportunities to develop yourself
A competitive salary with great advantages, like mobility budget, hospital insurance, performance -related bonus,...


Qualifications


University Master Civil Engineer (applied mathematics, IT or similar)
2 to 6 years’ experience as a consultant
Outstanding team player with great interpersonal and communication skills
Strong interest in data science and related sectors such as Energy and Finance
Analytical mind, exploring options and able to synthesize into conclusions
Dynamic, result oriented, rigorous and committed
Trilingual: French, Dutch and English
Prepared to participate in temporary assignments abroad


Additional Information



We are unable to provide a work permit for this position

Sia Partners is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.
